text: Okay~ not a fan at ALL!!! Meat WAS quetionable.. I don't know what type of meat they use but it is NOT BEEF!!! Not reccomended.. Chinatown has a nice soup u outta go there
Definitely one of the better pho places in the Henderson area. Service is kind of slow but overall the food is awesome and the staff is nice.

Usually good spicy chicken wings but today, it was terrible. Previously tried calling for take-out on my way there but no one answered my call for several minutes.  The chicken wings were dry and overcooked, probably recycled from yesterday. Too bad, used to be one of my favorites for this dish.  Might give it one more chance.

Great Chicken Pho! I've never been disappointed with the quality of their food or their service. My kids love this place too! Pho Mailan has great happy hour food specials. I had never tried Vietnamese food before trying it here...and its got to be some to the best Vietnamese cuisine in Henderson! If you're in the area stop by...you'll be happy that you did:)

This is my fave Pho place.  The place is nice, clean, not crazy crowded and the staff is great.  My order of the Mailan combo special beef pho is always on point.  Even when I walk in and order I don't ever wait long.  I love their pho!!!
As Vietnamese American who from central Vietnam, I'm surprise to find good bun bo Hue at Mai Lan.  My kids love the pho here too.

We always go here just for pho and calamari and the food is great, but the service needs work. I've been here many times and since the first time they greet you bring your food and along the way forget about you til the check. Not very attentive.   This visit the lady asked if i would like more water and I said yes. I thought she got busy because she hasn't brought it yet but she was just cutting the garnishes. Please don't ask if I want something when you don't mean to get it.

We dine there fairly often, but they have trouble following directions. For medical reasons, we can't eat jalapenos and similar peppers.. Today I called and ordered two types of banh mi sandwiches for take-out. I specified no jalapenos and had them repeat it back to me on the phone. When I drove over to pick up the sandwiches, the young woman who gave me our order said it was two banh mi with no jalapenos. - Guess what? Got the banh min home and opened them, and they both were loaded with jalapenos. I called to complain and they said to drive back and make an exchange, but I was not up for the round trip. I told them I would visit soon and expect either a full refund or two properly prepared banh mi. We tossed out the ones they gave me because even when the jalapenos are removed, the pepper oils still permeate the sandwich. - Very disappointing, and I will tell you this is not the first time that a menu item we've ordered, even dining in, was not the item that was delivered. You may think I am a chronic complainer, but I am not. It's just that this was the proverbial straw that ...etc, etc.
Excellent Pho, and they are brave enough to use tripe and tendon. Good service, nice modern decor. Prices are amazing, especially for the portions you get. I will return whenever I can.

I think this place is pretty good.  It seems like most of the poor reviews are related to customer service or some kind of language barrier.  The Pho, vermicelli and appetizers are all pretty good.  I go here all the time....

Poor customer service! Beware when placing an order for pickup! Gal on the phone told me the total would be $7.48 for a banh mi and side of broth..great, be there in 10 minutes! When I picked it up, the cashier said "oh, my manager DECIDED to raise your total charge to $9.50." WTH?!? Who does that? She didn't say she misquoted me on the price, but she literally said, my manager raised your price! Food was sub par.. Drive the extra mile and go to Pho Saigon 8 down Eastern.

Every time I am sick I head here! The pho #2 is my go to, as I am weird about meat and the flank steak is thin cut. However don't be alarmed when you get it to go it is raw, but it cooks in the soup! I tried the shrimp Pho, and it was tasty as well. You get a lot of shrimp. But pho #2 is amazing. Plus when you call for takeout it is ready in like 10 minutes. Overall really great pho, if you live in the area I recommend!

This is my go to Vietnamese place since its so close to my house.  The staff is probably the most friendly I've ever seen at at Vietnamese restaurant.  Their broth for the pho is very tasty and not overly fishy like some other restaurants in town.  Lemongrass chicken and the sliced pork are good too.  You can tell that they use high quality meats since they aren't overly fatty.    If you go between 3-6 pm you get 20% off too which makes this restaurant an even better deal!

This place was pretty decent, especially since there's several pho options within several miles of it. Had the standard pho with brisket and rare steak, it was good. Deep beef flavor in the broth, good size bowl full of everything pho should have. Summer (spring) rolls were mediocre, but acceptable. Large, clean dining room. Attentive, courteous staff and free Wi-Fi. Right around the corner from church, so I'm sure I'll go again and won't hesitate to recommend it to others. But overall nothing really that made it standout above the average pho spot.

Growing up with a Vietnamese mom, its hard to find a place that's at good as what Mom makes. Reminds me of her. She was recently in town & I brought her here for lunch. She loved it & couldn't get enough. We both prefer the Cha goi's without the wood ear mushroom & wrapped in rice paper but theirs are good too. When she left Vegas she made me promise to bring her back on her next visit, which I will gladly do.   This time around I tried the beef fried rice. Not what I was expecting, in a good way.  Enormous amounts of thinly sliced marinated beef atop a bed of rice. Mom had the rare beef Pho. Portions were just right.   btw...for those reviews based on a take away order...Pho is best eaten immediately when served, not in a take away order. Its a hot broth soup & meant to be eaten hot...not the next day or 20 minutes after you pick it up & get home.
I come here often and always have a great meal.  the service seems to get better each time and more efficient.  they really want you to enjoy yourself and have a great experience.
Stellar service and very good food. We tried rolls and a sandwich... next time we'll hit their noodles.

My boyfriend and I ate here for lunch today after Judd L. sent me a recommendation.The boyfriend wanted to go to Lemongrass because they have banh mi.. but I really wanted to try this place especially after we were able to locate it when we went to Lee's the night before.  It is very nice and clean. They have booths as well as tables. The service was very good and always made sure to fill waters and check if everything was good.  I do feel the the menu does lack some variety. No banh mi, so boyfriend ordered pho instead. I got the rare steak and tendon (as usual!)  and they gave a good amount of beef and tendon. The beef was nice and soft and the tendon was melt in your mouth with a couple exceptions for some chewy peices. I did find the broth to be a little more sour/too citrusy  than I'd like. But besides that it had a nice flavor.   Prices are not too bad either at $6.50 for a small and $7.50 for a large. They did give 20% off our bill for the grand opening.   Personally, Lemongrass is still my favorite in the area but Pho MaiLan is definitely a good alternative as well. More than I can say for Pho Saigon 8, and Pho Little Saigon. Will definitely return in the future.. I wanted to try to bun bo hue that the previous reviewers tried! I saw it.. but decided to go with my normal pho!
I love com Bo luc lac
Yummy Pho!  Definitely worth it during happy hour.

One of my favorite Pho restaurants & go to favorite. I always seem to order the P3 & spring rolls. Always delicious! The venue is open, clean & friendly.   It's also great that this place is close to home and away from the Eastern bottleneck of traffic.

Great food and for the most part, great service.  Just had one bad experience with one of the waitresses. She was very rude and was hurrying me when I was ordering to-go.  She kept saying "yeah yeah yeah" and was really rushing me.  Mind this,  there was no one behind me at all.  She did not say hello or even said thank you.  She did not even give me a receipt or even asked if I wanted one.  I had to ask if I could get one.  She was very unhappy that day but I'll still come back because the food is great and I usually have an overall great experience here.

I'm just not a fan of the Pho here. My husband and I both thought it was quite bland. We wanted to try it after reading the good reviews but we were not impressed. The service was good and the restaurant was clean but I'm not running back anytime soon. Sorry!
Great food and service.  Visited a friend in Henderson and was craving for pho. Friends recommended the restaurant which was perfect

We're from OC, PHO mainland and this place is on par with the best. The smoked salmon spring rolls were perfect and my pho was awesome. Thing I appreciate the most is that large actually means you get more, not just a bigger bowl! Thumbs up!

Have been here a few times without incident. Not sure if they are under new ownership but the food we ordered was not as good as I remember it. My boyfriend ordered the chicken, beef, and shrimp bowl and was up all night vomiting. It made him very sick. I ordered shrimp and chicken and it was served on a platter soaking in a brown liquid with half cooked noodles COVERED in broccoli, there was so much broccoli. It was the most disgusting concoction I've ever seen. It looked like they literally took every leftover bit of food and piled it on. Needless to say, we will never go back. We'll find another Pho, where the food is edible. This is a total letdown.

Omg! There Pho is delicious highly recommend I visit this restaurant frequently with my co-workers we are obsessed and it doesn't help our obsession that our office is right around the corner from this Gem !!

I was dying to love this place. I'm a big fan of pho and have eaten it in many cities, including some in Viet Nam. Unfortunately, it was just bland. There wasn't that spark that identifies soup as pho, for me. I don't know what it was missing; I just know it wasn't there. The summer rolls were ok, but, again, missing something (the peanut sauce was awesome, though). The iced tea was very good. The setting and service were really quite good. Now, if they could just add the spark...

A great Pho place needs only a few things:  1: Great soup. 2: Homemade noodles. 3: Nice people   This place has it all.  Quick, really tasty, and inexpensive.  You won't go wrong coming here.    They do a tremendous takeaway business too- always a steady stream of people picking up on the way up Eastern.

I've been coming here for years, maybe 6 or 7. It's probably my favorite Vietnamese place. And I still see familiar faces among the staff, managers, (owners maybe?).  We usually start off with some summer rolls, and order a large bowl of pho (noodle soup) with brisket and tendon. The beef short ribs / kalbi are super good, too! Also, the bahn mi pork sandwich... Mmm, yea.   Anyway, before you head out try the che thai, it's a sweet dessert. Coconut milk, crushed ice, lychee, jack fruit, and maybe something else I'm missing. I hate to leave without ordering it.   I noticed they won an award for the best Vietnamese Restaurant from... I don't know LV Weekly or LV RJ, Yelp! maybe? My point is, I'm glad they got the recognition they deserve :)  Thanks so much for all the great food!

This is the second time I've eaten here. Tonight I had the special which was Salmon Pho, thought this was interesting since I've never been anywhere thats offered salmon Pho. It was pretty yummy, I love salmon & I love pho so this was a great combo. Their broth is good, a lil oily but good.   Their service is good as well. I was being difficult in seating because I wanted to see the TV since my team was playing but they were very accommodating.   Restaurant was very clean and I was impressed with their decor, very modern & not your typical pho place. I will def be back.
Very good prices and look at the size of those spring rolls! I don't know pho, but I love bun. Delicious thin sliced pork sandwich in faux baguette. I can't wait to come back and try the spare ribs.
I'm a very picky person when it comes to good food.  This place has it!! I have tried so many Vietnamese Rest here and I love it here.  Good food, great service.
Generous amount and quick service! The pho came hot and fast and was tasty. They had quite a lunch rush. I'd return.

Went for the dinner tonight with my friends...had beef noodle,seafood noodle &chicken bbq.., food was ok but the service was horrible.   No waitresses came for check on see if we need anything else besides food.. I don't think will be back there any soon!

I can honestly say after eating at virtually every Vietnamese restaurant in town Pho Milan is one of the worst! Ingredients are usually not fresh, broth is bland and the service is mediocore. I've tried to support the place because its close to home, but no more.

I love this place.  I have a particular love for Hanoi Ca, otherwise known as Hanoi style fish preparation (grilled with dill and onions).  Not easy to find in most Vietnamese restaurants.  As a non Asian with a very western taste who likes most Vietnamese food as long as it is not too traditional (ie uses shrimp paste), I look for these types of Vietnamese restaurants who have westernized their menu.    We had our family reunion there, with lots of local and non local Vietnamese and myself.  We all left full and very happy with our meals.  My wife really likes Bun Bo Hue, which is also not often  well prepared, but here, she was delighted to find it very authentic.  Their combination pho made my mother in law very happy.  The price was very reasonable and the quantities were generous.  The tables are designed for large family gatherings, but they have tables for small groups as well.  The service was good and the place was very clean, something also rare to find in many restaurants.  Hope that this place considers serving Banh Xeo, Vietnamese Crepe, in the future.
Great spicy pork sandwiches, wings, and Pho Very Clean Place Prices are great!!!!
Make sure you give them the amount you wanna give coz you're not getting your change back.
The c11 was a good dish when I first got it but this time I got it and the bowl wasn't hot enough the onions were still raw but the beef was good which sorta made up for it.

Although the food is 3.5 out of 5. I give them 2 stars. Because how dry their service is every time I go there. 04/09/16, I came in at 8:07pm (they close at 9) I was told that they were closed because no soup left. Kinda weird that their sign was still blinking "open". Starting to hate this place because of their service.

I have been to this place for 3 times and now Pho MaiLan is where I recommend if you are craving for pho, spring rolls, and egg rolls. The all items were what I ordered every visit and I thought that the taste of all items has consistency as I was expecting at the 3rd visit.  I've tried other 2 pho restaurants, but I liked this place much better because I really liked the flavor of the broth and the taste of the egg rolls.  The service was pretty good too. One waitress was very friendly and nice when we requested some things we need. That's one of what I had good impression about this restaurant at the 3rd visit and it brought me to write a review. I think the service is also important and a part of how we can enjoy the food.   That day the only thing I didn't like much was "the beef stew with French bread". I ordered it my first time as it looked so good to me looking at the picture of the menu, but when it was brought it up to me, unfortunately it wasn't like at all the one I was expecting from the menu.  Oh well, I don't order it next time and just stick to what I always order here.

By far one of my favorite Pho eateries in Henderson. I've tried several surrounding ones and Pho Mailan has won me over. Servers are friendly, free wifi, atmosphere is awesome, and their food is delicious. Must try their spring rolls, egg rolls, and of course their pho! Thanks Pho Mailan for always fulfilling my pho cravings!

I love their Thai iced tea with grass jelly. It's not overly sweet like I've had in the past. It's just right, to my liking. Chicken Satay is always a fave and so is the Chicken Ph with egg noodle. What I will say is that the shrimp fried rice was not to my liking.   Overall, I have absolutely no complaints about the service, very sweet. I've ordered take out from Ph Mailan as well and my order is always complete.

Just had dinner with my family. When we first came in, the place looks nice unlike other Vietnamese restaurants, not too crowded but service was horrible. Ordered soup first and appetizer but felt too rushed. Finally, some of the main meal arrived except mine. Waited and waited and finally asked the waiter who said I didn't order but 3 main meal. Told him to forget about it. I lost my appetite after waiting for a while. Then few minutes later the waiter came back and said here is your order who told me a few mins ago that I didn't have an order. I am tired of going to Vietnamese restaurants who has little or no customer care at all. Will never go back nor recommend this place.    Ester
Came here for pho. Out of rice noodles at a Vietnamese restaurant? Got the egg noodles. Pho comes out 30 min later. Yes 30 minutes. Barely any meat. Not worth
It's clean, and the staff are quick and friendly.   I ordered the pho tai. It was decent but I would go to another pho place before I came back to this one.
Love the food! My business partner n I go there twice a week. Waitresses are very nice n sweet :) see ya soon!
Food are great!  spacious and clean restaurant. Servers and the manager were very kind and friendly too.

Great food, great price, great service.  This place is new, clean, and comfortable.  Rice noodle bowl with bbq pork and spring rolls was terrific.  Beef pho combo was also very good.  A good spot for a quick casual lunch.

I love coming here. Tonight was a really good night , not only did I get fast service and great food. My dearest friend Philip taught me how to use " chop sticks " ! Now who takes the time out to do that?? Philip does ,that's who! Not only did he do that he also mix my pho for me ! This by far had been the best restaurant experience I have ever had! This guy loves what he does and it genuinely shows. :-D  I had pho while I waited for my 3 Bahn mi sandwiches were being prepared. The music was lovely and so was the night and the weather for a nice bowl of pho.
Happy hour is only $5 for pho, and the broth is really good. It's clean, people are nice, and it's really cheap.
I come here quite frequently. The staff,the service ,the food is spot on every time! Keep up the great work;)

I am very impressed with this place. Had the Bun Bo Hue (Bun Bo Mailan as they call it here) and I wasn't disappointed! All good quality ingredients, no corners cut and most importantly, the soup stock was perfect.   A pleasant surprise is that they offer you Banana Blossom as part of the vegetables to dunk in your soup, I don't know anywhere that offers this and its one of the traditional must have ingredients.  The restaurant itself is nice and spacious, very clean and nice positive colours. The service was very good, didn't have to ask for a refill on drinks once.  I would defo go back, next time to try some Pho

We're not from here but stumbled upon this place while looking for somewhere to eat dinner at. I love Vietnamese food, and this place did not disappoint. I typically get the bun (noodle) dishes and enjoyed it very much. We came back again tonight, two days later.

Good. Was in the general area and in a pho mood, and chose this one because of four Yelp stars. Right on target; a solid four. We ordered P2 and B15 and the bill was under $30 including tax and tip (can't hate that). Service was very good. Wouldn't hesitate to go back, if we are hungry in Henderson.

Actually ate here last week!! Delicious!! I am a Pho nut!! We ordered several dishes a shrimp fried rice, beef w/noodles, pho and several different spring and egg rolls. Now I will say I have had better pho broth and egg rolls. However this place hit the spot and was still delicious overall! To top it off the employees, especially the cashier were super sweet and friendly! I'm so glad to have found a pho place close to home!

Service was not so good tonight. We had to ask for utensils after they served our food. I ordered pho with tendon and got one lousy piece. When I asked for a few more pieces, it finally came but was not cooked all the way and was cold in the middle. We had to ask for things at least 4 times that should have been provided in the first place.

The food was excellent.  Service, also excellent.  I would go back if there weren't 5 other excellent pho places between my house and it.  My only complaint was that they took away my chopsticks and gave me a fork and knife when I ordered a rice dish.  I don't know if they were assuming that I didn't know how to use the chopsticks for a rice dish or if I would just need a fork and knife, but it felt very presumptuous.  I'd rather use the chopsticks.  But, minor complaint.  It was excellent other than that.  You should go.
Amazing.  The food was great but the service was even better.   I just found my new favorite spot.  Me and Pho Mailan have just became friends.
P2 and you're in pho heaven. They don't rush you out. Toddlers do get place in the corner table but as a parent I can appreciate that
My favorite Vietnamese resturant in town. Food is awesome and the staff is so friendly! Very clean Resturant to. High recommend.

I will not eat Pho anywhere else after discovering this place! My husband and I are regulars and are always treated with so much respect. They are so sweet to our son and always have our food out within minutes of us sitting down. Best service, best staff, and best food

I decided to try a new Pho location other than Jenni Pho. This one had good reviews and I just so happen to be on this side of town. It was really busy which is always a good sign. However, the pho tai nam lacked a lot of flavor. The broth needs more spices and flavor to it. I had to add a lot of extra items to the pho that I usually don't add to get some type of flavor that was digestible. I definitely will not be returning.
Best pho place in the valley I should say. Everything is just great. I always get the all meat pho, P1. I also love their goi cuon and pork and shrimp salad.

I come here often for lunch. Its a very clean and friendly restaurant. Today I ordered vermicelli noodles with beef instead of pork w/egg rolls. It was delicious as always. I ordered a dessert to go. It had coconut juice, jackfruit, jelly, and other fruits w/shaved ice. Very refreshing!!!

Food was good, but service was poor, inconsistent, and rude. We dined in, ate pho and waited for happy hour. We ordered happy hour to go, but they would not let us take it to go. They said that happy hour was dine in only and that there was a sign outside that stated this. We investigated the whole restaurant and there was nothing that said happy hour was only for dine in. Restaurant was really slow and when we spoke to the owner they were rude and gave hand negative hand gestures cueing that they were annoyed by us. I like the food, but I will never again come to this place.

Decent service. Somewhat dirty facility. Restroom was grimy. Meats were a little too salty for my taste but a smoker might love this place. Too much star anise in broth. Again, my preference, not bad flavor, just not my preference. Portions were generous and good price to food value. I wish I liked their interpretations of Vietnamese better but I think I'll be taking the drive to Spring Mountain when I need my pho fix.
I get stuck in other parts of the city, but I still make the drive to the best Pho' and service in the area

Nice, clean environment and you won't have to wait to be seated. Servers aren't the best I've had, but the food is great if your craving Vietnamese food. I to-go the B1 combination for home and it's flavorful. As for Pho, the P1 special combination is a personal favorite. If you like Vietnamese food, Pho Mailan is a great option.

Me and my boyfriend when to have dinner here hoping that it be good we sat down and the restraunt stunk like crazy so bad we almost left. Our food we ordered wasnt that great  I was expecting  something better Rather just drive a little bit further  for a better pho restraunt

It was hot outside and when you get in here it was as hot as well! We were sweating!   The coconut juice i ordered is not fresh, tasted odd!   Not much vegetables and meat! Though meat was tasty  Wont come back!

I am so excited that the wife and I decided to try this place!   We decided to give it a try 3 weeks ago and we have been back twice since. The food is delicious, the waiter gives great suggestions and has a great sense of humor. The decor is clean and nicer than the other places in town. We have tried a few different items from the menu and have loved each one

I've been meaning to write a review for Pho Mai Lan for awhile, but did not have a yelp account.  Then I realized, I use yelp all the time to find restaurants, that it is now time to contribute.  So, I've been going to Pho Mai Lan since it opened almost 2 years ago.  I would say for Vegas, this is up there with the best Pho in town.  I always order #6, beef, meatballs, and tendons.  They have a consistent fresh flavor.  This is the cleanest pho restaurant I've ever been to, and the vegetables are fresh everyday.  This beats driving to spring mountain and I think the quality and taste is just as good if not better.

The store had some hiccups. With phones which bothered me a bit but I love coming here because they give me good friendly service.  And the foods pretty good.  I wish they would give a little more but it's still filling.  The broth is pretty clean and tasteful.

If I could give -1 I would . Although if you love PHO it's great. I ordered salmon taste like cardboard. They didn't seem to care.Service was terrible a big group of like 20 came in and got all there attention...Place really f_ c_ k_ ing sucks. Rather have bad food and good service but not both Bad service and bad food

Worse service ever! Heard all the hype about how great this place is. They even have a huge banner out front that said it was voted best Vietnamese restaurant. However, when we entered we waited for 15 min to be seated even though there were 9 tables open, granted most were dirty but it took another 5 minutes for someone to actually clean one of the tables up and then sit us. Then we waited another ten minutes before someone came to take our order. When we ordered beef pho, the waiter then proceeded to tell us they were out of beef pho and only had chicken pho. We were there during lunch hour on a Friday. How do you run out of your most favored menu item during a weekend lunch hour? Terrible service. Completely disappointed. We left and tried a pho place down the street.

The Pho here is average. They have an afternoon happy hour if you need to save a few bucks. There are better Pho places in the city but as far as Henderson area, this will be your best bet. I usually get an order of spring rolls and either a vermicelli dish or the rare steak Pho.

We came here to try their foods, and found very dissatisfied. 1) We ordered their Pho, and asked for slices of lemon to  be put into our ice water, to illiminate it's chlorine smell, also to squeez into the soup. They said that they do not have it. How can a Vietnamese restaurant does not have lemon for their customer? 2) the Pho came like a luke warm water, and the beef was overcooked. 3) we ordered BBQ chicken and egg rolls on the top of rice. Their egg rolls were ok, but, the BBQ chicken was darker and burnt. On a whole, their foods, from our experiences, are not qualified to be called as VIETNAMESE foods

Every time I come here, I am always seated immediately. The service is super friendly, and I've never had a bad experience. I come here every week for the shrimp pho and fried egg rolls.  :) My boyfriend is always daring, and gets something new almost every time. He has never not liked anything. Highly recommended!

This place is usually good but today not so good! Order Pho' and I can say literally swimming in fat oil. My mouth feels like it has so much grease that a cup of water and hot tea cannot take away. On a positive note the service is great and the staff is friendly.
It was quick and clean with friendly service. I've had better Vietnamese at other local places. Reasonably priced for lunch. Spent $22 for 2 ppl. I had the Combo Vermicelli Bowl.

Overall really solid pho. I've had some appetizers here and none have blown my socks off, but the pho is super tasty. Service is decent and the restaurant is nice and clean - definitely a good go-to spot.

Stopped by here a couple weeks ago for a late lunch. The place is clean and has a tv on the wall. I'm not sure what channel it was on, but it was that program where they show you the process of making something in a factory. We caught it from the middle to the end. It turned out to be a garage door. I thought that it was pretty entertaining.   I had the Pho Tai Sach w/my beef on the side. The veggies were fresh. The broth was good. The size of the bowl was decent. The beef was fresh and there was a good amount.  I will give them another try next time I'm in the neighborhood.  Thanks for lunch LiLy D!
Terrible! I feel like Pho is tough to mess up but they did! The meat was mediocre at best. We also ordered teriyaki beef and that was really fatty. The meats all together we're really low quality.

Well...I will admit that Pho is NOT a FAV of mine. I know this place was voted Best in Henderson, and my visit did nothing to change my mind OR TASTEBUDS!! BLEH---       the chic satay w/ peanut sauce.....my comment "THAT'S CHICKEN? I've never seen chicken that looks like that!" Tasted my husband's (he thinks this place is the Bomb!) Pho Beef Soup w/ seafood...... Also just not my thing....Just Ikky~ our server was young, & she didn't understand us, nor we her.   Might I try it again??? I can't imagine why, however I have learned Never to say Never~
Pho-licious!  I keeps it real and stick with the chicken.

For a place with the name Pho in it you would think the Pho would be awesome but its really not. Its majorly lacking in flavor. It almost tastes like its just beef broth with no Pho spices!!! In fact I think the broth is not authentic at all it does taste like its can beef broth.  I was hoping it was good because they are right across the street from me and sometimes i'm just too lazy and tired to spend 8 hours making my own Pho, but I was very disappointed. Not to mention the seafood pho is majorly lacking in good quality squid and the scallops are a joke their pea sized!!! why even put it in there then?! if I want good Pho I have to drive down to Pho Saigon 8 over in the Chuck E Cheese complex. In addition this place is majorly over priced!!! I have never had to pay $10 for Pho and its not even good!!! That's ridiculous!!! this place is way to over priced. Driving down to Pho Saigon 8 will save you almost $3 per person!!! yeah I have to say the price is just way over the top for being a simple Vietnamese place. If you are familiar with Vietnamese food the ingredients are not expensive at all. I will not be coming back here, I will make the small extra drive to save money and have better Pho.

This place is by pho the best pho I've ever had it's unphogettable all joking aside. Great place I will pho sure comeback to this place.Only a phocking idiot would pass this place up.All I have say is pho get about it this place is awesome.The prices are phocking shocking very well priced for the quality and amount food.              PHO LIFE

The pho here is delicious, but it doesn't excuse the sanitation here.  I've gotten sick here twice and my son got hand foot disease here.  Maybe I didn't wipe the seat down well enough? But why should I be wiping EVERYTHING down? That's just ridiculous.  The service here is also terrible, you can barely flag anyone down and when you do get a hold of someone, it takes a good minute for them to get it for you regardless of how busy the place is.  I will not continue going to this place and honestly I don't suggest anyone should either. #sorrynotsorry
It was a very satisfied dish. I like the egg taquitos. Pretty good value for meal I will go again definitely.

I came here on a kinda whim 'cause the boyfriend was sick, and I thought he'd want some good pho to make him feel a bit better. The ladies greeted me right away, and since I already knew that I wanted pho with beef, they gave me a recommendation. Ended up ordering 1 small and 1 large of the Pho Dac Biet to go, and I got the food within 10 minutes.  LOL. Ladies, please remember to charge your customers that order to go before handing them the food. If I wasn't an honest person, I would've walked out without paying.  Anyway, I think I spent about $22, including tip.  I'll be sure to eat in as a different and future experience.

Nice ambiance,fast service.Food here are ok.My friend and I ordered Pho Tai/pho Tai Chin.I ordered Pho Chay(Vegetable) and fried egg rolls(Cha goi).The food were ok not bad but not outstanding.However,I am not sure whether I will come back to this place again since there are better Pho places in the area.

I am so excited!  They opened this Vietnamese restaurant like 4 minutes from my house.  Yay!!! My wife and I just returned from having dinner there.  We both ordered the MaiLan special - Bun Bo Hue.  Man, it was awesome!  There was a great deal of meat in it and it was spicy as heck.  I was sweating bullets.  But, it was SOOO good.  I downed my Thai Tea and drank like 3 glasses of water.   As for atmosphere, very casual.  The restaurant is quite open and clean.  It has a calming effect.  We didn't care too much for the pictures ~ for some reason, they have a cyclist picture in an Asian restaurant.  Figure that they would have more of an Asian theme.  But, really, we weren't there for the pictures.   As for the service, it is a family run operation and they really take care of you.  And, yes, thank god, they actually talk to you and ask you how was your experience.  Customer Service is something that is usually lacking in a lot of Viet restaurant (i.e. Pho Saigon 8 - yuck).    We highly recommend this place.  And, we definitely would be back to Pho Mailan... Yay!!!
I've tried so hard to like this place since it's the closest pho place to go to for me. It's been a disappointment the 5 tiimes I've gone.
The first time I went here, the pho was ok. One month later, they really improved the soup's flavor and I would tell anyone who wanted pho to come here.
Definitely my favorite Pho place! They use very fresh ingredients and their food has a great flavor. They have a happy hour menu with various food selections from 3-5 on weekdays!

I love the variety of appetizer selections they have here. It's pretty vegetarian friendly too. Ordered  fried vegetarian egg rolls and the meatball pho.  The broth of their pho is really flavorful and fragrant. It comes with fresh mint leaves so you can pluck off and add to your liking. Egg rolls were pretty good too, filled with the thin clear noodles and veggies plus lettuce so you can wrap the egg roll like a lettuce wrap. I'm assuming that's what your supposed to do.  Service is always great. I was lingering there longer than usual and catching up with a friend and our server was really sweet and never gave us the stink eye to leave.  Oh and the iced green tea is actually steeped from tea leaves and not those ground up teabags. Winning!

It was not until I was seated with my hot plate of pho in front of me that I noticed the glaring "C" grade displayed in a semi conspicuous location. I havIe to admit that seeing the grade had a negative impact on my overall experience.  From the outside the place is spacious, modern and appears clean. The service is friendly and to the point. They are located up Eastern near the Anthem area. I had their No 1 combo while my husband opted for Vermecelli. The broth was fine - it was savory with a decent amount of flavor. They skimped on the meat that's for sure.  I really did not find it mind blowing enough to return after their "C" grade slip up. I had their pho once before and it was "fine" enough to return, but this was before the grade. As I mentioned before, the broth is solid but not mind blowing nor the best in town by any stretch. I think it will do well with the Anthem clientele -- just get the grade under control! Had it not been for the grade issue I would say this is a solid 3.5 joint.

This restaurant serves good food, specially their spicy beef noodle soup. I am only giving it 3 stars because I once ordered a fresh spring roll for pick up after work, and when I got home and opened the box, they roll was dry and have week old lettuce, browning on the edges, very dry, well stored pork and shrimp stuffs. In short, it was awful. But I dont think it deserves a 1 star. They do serve some good hot noodle soups.  Given a choice between this resto or Saigon 8 on Eastern and 215- I would go to Saigon 8.

Pho is always my go to meal, especially when it's a little chilly and gloomy out--it just screams pho weather. :)   I love coming to this place for my pho cravings mainly because of the generous serving of meat that comes in a small bowl and the super tasty and tangy broth. The broth is what makes it or breaks it for me when it comes to pho and I can honestly say that Pho Mai Lan, does their broth RIGHT! I barely have to put any hoisin or limes to get it to my liking.   Another thing that's a must have item on their menu is their Vietnamese style coffee. I am literally fueled by coffee alone so I take it pretty seriously lol ¯\_(?)_/¯ it's brewed traditionally and comes with the right amount of sweetened condensed milk.   A great time to come here is definitely during lunch because their regular beef pho and chicken pho bowls are just $5.00!  With the temperature slowly decreasing, pho weather is everyday, So head on down to Anthem and give this gem of a place a try! :)

The food was ok and the service was not great! They were very stingy compared to other Pho places we've been to. They gave us one small plate for 3 bowls of soup. The one thing one girl was up on was our water refills.

Idk how this place has so many reviews and still has 4 stars. I ordered the seafood pho. It was bland and very average. They charged extra for seafood, then they wanted to charge extra for extra broth. I was like wtf? It's flavored water. Also waitresses weren't very nice or accommodating. Have had a lot of pho in my time and the all around food and service ranks as one of the worst.

I was excited to see this location had opened up since it is so close to my house. I finally stopped by with my mom one day. It was not very crowded but it took a while for us to be seated and we just awkwardly stood there. We were seated and it still took a while before anyone came to take our drink order. I probably would have left if I weren't really craving it. The food was all right. Wasn't the best or worst I've had. But I won't be going bacl

Was very disappointed with this place.  Been going to a ramen place down the street for a while and always leave full and happy....   came here after hearing all the hype about pho and wasnt happy.  i totally would pick ramen over pho any day!!!!  the egg rolls were very good and that was the only good thing about the dinner!

Best pho in Las Vegas.  This place has become our favorite in Las Vegas. We have always have a good experience.  I usually do beef & flank pho and a side order of summer rolls.   Highly recommend this place.

It is 4 star because I think they deserve it . Also I'm not a fan of the modern decor but I will say this it is clean very clean with good service and a good pho. Also the pricing is what it is probably because off the location being st the mouth of anthem.  There are just so many pho places on eastern I think they need to step up the flavor a bit.  One good note is opening at 10 am as sometimes we do pho for Sunday breakfast.  Been here many many times and highly recommend it.

Our first time at this place and we are very satisfied with the food, the cleanliness of the place & most of all the service.   When we sat down someone was taking our drink order in less that a minute.  The host said is very polite & said Thank you before leaving our table to deliver our order.  My friend & I ordered a large bowl of Pho to share and the host, named T, actually scooped our soup into our individual bowls. That to me, is exceptional.  The food is delicious and the price of it is very reasonable. Worth every penny.  We will go back! Most def!!!!

Pho Mailan is a good restaurant with good service. I always get the Summer Rolls and Pho Meatball which both have great flavor. I usually go in on a Sunday evening as they have the football game on a flat screen. Glad there is one near home now. I will definitly be back

Nice, clean family run business. Very nice ambience, super friendly staff and the best part-food is fresh and delicious! Summer rolls are huge and freshly made, rice bowl dishes just the right size, and the shrimp fried rice-so light and yummy with grilled medium shrimp (not those tiny ones normally used). Highly recommend.

The service food and atmosphere were "slightly" above par when this place first opend. However, after having a poor experience 6 months ago, we decided not to return until last week. Upon our return, the food server was extremely unwelcoming and appeared to be in a hurry as we were trying to place our order. We were apologized to by another staff member who really did not know what they were apologizing for. We asked for the manager, but he or she was unavailable. Will NEVER return........
$5 for chicken Pho!! You betcha. It was great as well. I'll definitely be coming back. Friendly staff that kept my water glass full.

I came here for the happy hour special. I was pretty impressed. I had the combination Pho and it was really good. The broth had a little more flavor than other Pho places and it didn't taste like just cilantro. For people who like spicy I recommend putting in the jalapenos they serve with some chili garlic sauce.  I also had some kind of Pork sandwich. I forgot the name. But it was also good. It was served on a crusty french baguette with cucumber slices and some sore of carrot/cabbage slaw mix. The pork itself had a sweet sauce around it, somewhat like General Tsos or Sesame chicken.   Good service and the place was extra clean. I will be returning.  Update.  I've made this place my goto spot for Pho. After eating at at least 5 other Pho places, Pho Mailan easily has the best. It's super clean, the service is extremely friendly and the food is very very good. The happy hour special is great. During the week from 3-5pm they have 5 dollar bowls of Pho, and 3 dollar sandwiches. What a steal!  My only problem with this place is that it's only open til 9pm, and since I work odd hours if i get the itch for Pho I have to travel to Spring Mountain and eat sub par alternatives in the middle of the night. I wish they we're open late!!!  I've eaten at Pho Mailan like once every two weeks for the past 4 months and never have had one complaint.
Great first experience for new neighborhood pho place.  I tried the pho thai, shrimp + sugar cane lettuce wraps and they were both great.

This restaurant is located in Henderson, don't have to drive to China town to get my Asian food fixed . Price is reasonable, portion is adequate to huge. Place is simple and look like any type of Asian restaurant in China Town. Quick services . Ordered the summer spring rolls, cold noodles with stir fry beef( bun bo xao) pho special& three beans drink. Reason for 3 stars because hubby didn't like his pho much, he stated it is too bland, there was no basil  leaves to go along in the pho. Again there was no mints leaves in the cold noodles or the spring rolls . The bean wasn't soft and came with jello like strips instead of the chewy jelly kind that you usually get in a true typical Vietnamese restaurant. Meat was also a little tough but they do give you plenty
Just picked up some pho tai from there on the way home. Broth so cool beef wouldn't cook. If you want some crappy cold pho give them a shot!

Agree with the yelpers who say this is just an okay pho place. We come often because it's close to home and my hubby likes it (not a foodie like me). I have yet to find great pho in Vegas like when we lived in San Diego almost 30 years ago.
Pho is great here and excellent service. Happy hr is legit and I will keep coming back!
Best Pho in town for a great price. The summer rolls are great too!

I don't know why this place has good reviews..I think maybe because there isn't another good pho place that's close by..but this place is not good! I've tried it a few times and my opinion still hasn't changed, food is blah! Do yourself a favor and drive down Eastern a little bit for better options!

Delicious pho, with many varieties to sample.  Fresh, hot and tasty.  Generous quantity of beef (if you like that in your pho).  Very friendly staff and low key but clean surroundings.  Very good prices, easy in and out, quick and plenty of parking.   The only (minor) complaint is sometimes the noodles are not thoroughly cooked - I mean just a few of them, not the whole bowl.   Highly recommend.
We have ordered take out two times now. The service has always been great and the pho is delicious. Definite must if you are looking for delicious pho!

This place always hits the spot. Their food has never been anything less than amazing no matter what we order (although the P7 and C5 seem to be our go to favorites). The staff is always friendly and the restaurant is always clean. This will always be a go to spot for pho-tastic Vietnamese food (excuse the pun)

I've had lunch and dinner here a few times before but it seems that the service, quality, and taste of the food has gotten worse. The sign outside as Voted #1 in Vegas is BOGUS and no longer an accurate description of this restaurant. The food is super salty. Food is mediocre at best!! The restaurant is dirty. The utensils are very old and could use a good polish and a good scrub. The service was awful. VERY, VERY, VERY slow and RUDE waitress. The waitress kept forgetting our table and the restaurant was not busy at all. Had to ask for water twice and the waitress forgot to put the order in the kitchen. We waited and watched while two other tables were served their food. The only time the waitress came back to our table is to give the check and she hovered and stood over me while I took the money out of my wallet. RIDICULOUS. I do not recommend this restaurant at all. There are plenty of other Vietnamese restaurant down on Eastern worth checking out.

Ah! First time here! Great menu! Busy place! Ceiling tiles need to be replaced! Dusty air vents too! Food splashes on the walls! Initially taken to a dirty table! Now out of chicken broth? I will give them my free inspector review!

Just ate there a few minutes ago..my son and I was so famished, excited to eating at Pho Milan. I ordered P7 small, as we got our food..I hand picked my basil leaves all the time and then something moved in my bowl...it was a green LITTLE WORM wiggling...Yuk!! I ask the waitress to give me a new one, she even got grosse out. I was surprised they did not comp the meal.We  don't know if it's still the same owner but the quality of food is not the same. The beans sprouts are a little brown. We always thought they have a great food. Now I don't know if we'll be back again.  It's sad and the service is terrible. I gave 1 star just because but it needs to improve quality and service.

MSG soup. Large pho  is not very large compare other restaurant. Just large bowl with lots of soup and little content. Might as well order the small.  Their vegetables are not fresh. Checkout the dark spot and withering basil served with their pho. Yuck!  There is catch on their happy hour 20% off. It is only on their small pho.

My standard for Vietnamese food maybe a little high given the fact that I lived in SoCal about a 20 minute drive from Westminster/Little Saigon.  While the service here is very good for an asian restaurant, and the restaurant itself is clean and modern compared to most vietnamese restaurants, the food was just OK. I ordered the Grilled Pork and it was too fatty and salty (even for me who likes to eat salty) :-(

Two Years Later, and my Weekly Visit to MaiLan is Still the Same, Awesome!  I always get the All White Chicken Meat Chicken Broth Pho and add Tai (Filet Steak) to it, with extra noodles, Best in USA. Sometimes I get a side Pork Chop, which is so good I feel like I'm eating Filet Mignon sometimes!  My Vietnamese counterpart changes up with a variety of orders, which says a lot about the authentic quality of the Restaurant!

This happens every time my husband is sick with a cold. We have to find a decent Pho place close to the house so I can pick up the body and mind healing soup, to cure whatever ails him. I came across Pho MaiLan. The broth is very good, not as much basil as I like to be served but the waiters were very nice and brought extra. I always order Meatball Pho with extra meatballs. If you cannot let your broth and meatballs stand alone then you don't have good pho. The meatballs are very well balanced and had a great texture. I love it when I order extra and I get extra! They pass my test and made my husband feel very good. To top it off they serve Three Color Bean Dessert, if you have never had this, it is a great culinary experience. It consists of a white bean sweetened with condensed milk, a sweet red bean, and a rice jelly of some kind, usually green and cut into strips with a wavy slicer. Layered like a trifle and topped with coconut milk and shaved ice. It is spectacular and so refreshing and fun to eat. They make a very good one here. I recommend trying it if you feel adventurous.

Went here "late" the other night and had some pho.  The staff were super kind and willing to answer my date's questions about pho.  I had the sausage roll appetizer and pho with meatballs, round eye, and brisket.  The appetizer was just alright.  It had alright flavor but was dry.  I suppose I could've used more of the sauce but I am not the biggest fan of peanut sauce so I just used soy sauce and lime juice which seemed to do the trick.  The pho itself was tasty but there wasn't anything too special about it.  It wasn't amazing and it definitely wasn't bad.  Maybe I'm just not a pho guy but for what it was, I enjoyed it and had no complaints.  Go ahead and give it a try yourself!

First time sitting down here to eat, I would usually stop in for take out. I was very happy I stayed in and ate here.  I ordered the large P.3 Pho tai chin, it was delicious! The meat was very tender and melted in my mouth. I feel like the large was too much food for me, I should have ordered the small. The veggies that they brought out for us were very fresh and clean!   The waiting staff were all very friendly and kind, they went out of the way to make sure we were taken care of and it really made me feel happy. I would totally recommend trying this place out if you're in the area.

I used to like this place and went a lot, but I stopped going when there was a big piece of plastic mixed in my soup.  I guess they were just in too much of a hurry to remove it.  I actually saw another reviewer say the same thing before it ever happened to me.  I guess I didn't believe him or want to until it happened to me too.  I drive a little farther down the hill now to go to one of the 3 pho places down by the 215.  The Pho Mailan broth was a little bland anyway compared to the others, but I had been willing to overlook that due to the convenient location until the plastic incident happened.
had the pho with tendon, brisket, and beef balls....YUMMO! Ordered their HUGE sandwiches to go! Just in case i get a little hungry later. Service was consistent and food was amazing!

We stopped by on a Sunday evening for dinner. They were moderately busy, but there were plenty of open tables, so we were seated right away.  The decor and ambience is comfortable, friendly and clean. There isn't any of the usual Vietnamese restaurant smell upon walking in. The service is very friendly and attentive.  The food tastes very good. I would say they are above average in terms of taste. You definitely get good value for your money.  Overall, if you're in the mood for some pho or other Vietnamese-styled food, this place will make you happy. If I could give this place a 4.5, I would.

The place looks cute. When it comes down to the food my boyfriend and i got the eggrolls, soup w ribeye steak, and marinated beef plate. eggrolls weren't that great it was ok. the soup kind of tasted weird but the marinated beef plate was really good served a lot of fat though. I would come again for the marinated beef plate. they brought out the food in a timely manner. service was great.

Normally on the weekends I wouldn't schlep all the way to Henderson for my Vietnamese/Pho fix unless I'm going there during the week from the office.    But on a lazy Saturday afternoon, I was extended an invitation for the official official grand opening of Pho MaiLan with 20% off the meal.  Noodle Houses are not known for ambiance but based on first impression upon arrival, the vibe inside has a fun and relaxing interior.  Me and Mr. UK David C. ordered the Large Bun Bo MaiLan (their version of Bun Bo Hue) AKA (MaiLan spicy beef and pork noodle soup). By default, MaiLan doesn't have the congealed pig blood like a traditional BBH, but I actually prefer it without it. They loaded my bowl with a decent portion of protein which I always appreciate when I eat a bowl of noodle soup.  I put in my veggies (a sprinkling of bean sprouts and they have banana blossoms which I'm sure you won't find in many shop in the US, let alone Vegas).  A nice squeeze of some lime in my eye and in the soup of course.    Hell, I even managed to forget the sting of lime juice burning my eyeball for several minutes while I devoured my bowl of deliciousness.  The broth was nice with the right amount of spiciness that is enjoyable and very flavorful. You can really tell that they use good quality ingredients and prepare everything very well.  For a busy grand opening, the service was consistent and attentive to our needs and I never had to ask them to refill my glass of water.  I will have to try the Pho Dac Biet (Combination Special) and Cha Gio (Crispy Spring Rolls) next time to really round out this review.  We may have a potential new contender for favorite Bun Bo Hue but certainly room for improvement for a future UYE or lunch visit.  It will mos def be in the my lunch rotation going forward pho shizzle!
I love this place -convenient location and great food! If you are looking for great Vietnamese in Henderson, this is the place to go.
Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in town for PHO. Excellent service, good location, good prices, and the happy hour from 3-5 daily is a great bonus. Definitely worth a visit.

The Spring Rolls are amazing!!  This a really great Vietnamese restaurant.  Not just Pho.  All sorts of wonderful things!  The service was very attentive and the menu creative and lovely.  The ingredients were super fresh and I just loved it.  I'll be back!

I found this hidden gem about 6 months ago. Just as good as any of the spots on spring mountain. Food is always hot and fresh. Service is friendly and fast. We eat here 1-2 times per week. Family owned and operated. I have not once been disappointed. Keep up the good work!!
The pho here is very good. Soup is flavorful and clean. Chicken satay is ok but a little bit dry.
new place ... very clean good service ... waitress is hard to understand english ... food was good as well ... i have tried the rice dish and pho portions on smaller side but was very tasty.

My visit here last night was not so great.   I came here for some quick dinner. No one came up to me as I waited in the front to be seated. Instead, a teenage employee in the back waited for me to look at him and pointed to a booth where I could sit. A lot of the workers there looked young and they were not attentive at all.   The pho tasted good, but it smelled horrible. It smelled just like a pet store! It was hard for me to eat it because of the stench and I'm surprised that I never got sick from it last night or this morning. Also, they gave me my pho without chopsticks or a spoon. I tried looking for a waiter so I could ask for one, but again, they are all inattentive. I had to get up from my seat and ask for one since all of the employees were talking amongst themselves in a corner of the restaurant.   I honestly did not give a tip because it felt like I was rushed out of there (it was not busy at all) and I was not paid attention to while the waiters constantly checked up on the other customers. You're better off at Lemongrass Cafe where their staff is actually nice and their pho is amazing and cheap.

Great recommendation by my friend! I came during their happy hour with my boyfriend (which is 3-5). They have select appetizers for $5 and some of their pho selections are cheaper. Since it was our first time there we ordered their combination special. It did not disappoint!!! I'm not a great teller on what's super good pho wise but my viet boyfriend is! Lol But I didn't have to be an expert to agree that the broth here is great! It's on the top of our list now. Great amount of meat in each serving, and they also have the option of having a smaller/larger bowl. The small was perfectly filling for me and we also had their spring roll appetizer which was delicious! I'll definitely be back.
Really amazing and quick service and pho - tasty and very accommodating for food allergies/modifications. Great place - recommend it for take out.

Where's the beef?  I am use to more meat in my pho.  I fished out 5 slices...pretty weak!  The price is on the high side considering the size of the bowl & the lack of meat.  Flavor was decent...    The springrolls looked like an 8 year old rolled them.  I've made better tasting & more uniform springrolls at home.  The place is hit or miss on service depending on who's working.  It's actually very good for the most part...the younger kid isn't the one you want waiting on you.  It's a clean place...they just need to iron out the wrinkles.  It's close to me so I guess I will eventually give them yet another shot, but this time trying out their rice dishes & banh mi.

I am so happy there is a good Vietnamese restaurant here! Came in on a Thursday night and got seated right away! Staff was very friendly. I liked the fact that we order coffee and the waiter made sure to let us know that it will take awhile because they way Vietnamese coffee is brewed. We order Pho of course with fried egg rolls on the side. What I liked is that they had a variety of Vietnamese food and some restaurants do not have that. I'm so happy I found a good Vietnamese restaurant whenever I'm back in Vegas I know where to go!
Been coming here since 2011 ! The food, service and price is excellent ! They've added Happy Hour [from 3-5] too - don't miss it !

Walked in at 8:25, they close at 9:00, male said we are closing in 5 minutes (even though sign on door still says closing at 9:00) they turned us away, then as we were walking out he says wait if you can order in 5 minutes we can stay...um no we are out, terrible service. Besides they aren't the only Pho in Henderson any longer...

Came here last week.  The food was good, I don't have any complaints about it but my wife is Vietnamese and so has very high standards as to her critiques.  So it wasn't mind-blowing Pho so thats why only 3 stars.  However what is worthy of noting is the great service we experienced when we were here.  Unfortunately we sat in a booth that was neighboring two girls who were seated behind my wife.  These girls were absolutely disgusting: they were burping loudly, singing loudly (horribly), throwing stuff at each other, and just being completely rude, childish, and disruptive.  At one point water starts dripping down the booth almost getting my wife's clothes wet.  The manager happened to be there and I pointed to it and he looked up as if it was the ceiling leaking, I told him where the source was from though: the girls.  He very politely asked them to stop throwing spit balls (yup, they were shooting spit balls at each other and throwing ice cubes), and they were very rude to him saying "what? what?" Then my wife got up turned around and told them to knock the shit off.  To our surprise they weren't 15 year old girls but two 26 year olds, one of whom was wearing scrubs (geeze I hope she's not an actual nurse)  He apologized and apologized to us like 5 times, which was awesome but we wish they would have apologized to him.  Anyways they left him a nasty note and we left him a good tip.  But that attitude you just rarely see: the one where the manager is ensuring the experience for all his guests is a good one, with total disregard to whether or not it is his fault or the fault of others.  This guy deserves a raise, he is a great worker here.  And for that I have upped my review to 4 stars.

As much as we wanted to like this place we could not get over the fact that the soup broth was watery and lacked flavor. We have had better. I gave them one star because our waitress had great customer service.

Affordable, fast, and yummy.  We'll definitely visit again!  I ordered the B4 (Bun Cha Gio Thit Nuong) which is a vermicelli bowl with pork and imperial rolls.  It was pretty standard, nothing fancy.  The pork had great flavor and was tender, plus there was a lot of it!  The imperial rolls were delicious, too.  My friend ordered the BM2 (Banh Mi Thit Nuong), a pork sandwich.  They said it was also pretty good.
Went here a couple days ago and guess what??? They were outta Pho!!! Are you Pho-ken kidding me???  It's like going to a Pizza parlor only to be told "sorry we are out of Pizza!"

Our first visit here turned out well.  Got greeted and seated immediately.  Looking through the menu at first was a little overwhelming.....consisted of several pages to peruse through.  We settled on large bowls of Pho beef noodle soup.  If you want vegetables in your soup then you have to request an "add on" (additional $2.50 charge) so we ordered one extra veggie bowl on the side and 2 of us were able to share it.  We found the soup to be very flavorful and filling!  Don't drink all the broth if you need to watch your sodium intake!  The staff provided good service and were attentive. We will absolutely come back and try other items!  :-))
Sorry Pho Mailan some how the wrong number was entered after I had the right number.

We just love their Pho.  Can't comment on anything else since that is all we order.   I usually get take-out.   Deep flavor of the broth and lots of tasty and fresh vegs to add.  Choose which meats you like.  Friendly staff and prices that are great.

First time here and wasn't too impressed by the food.  Upon entering the restaurant, I must admit it's cleaner than most Vietnamese restaurants I have been to.  The staff was ok.  Takes awhile to be seated even when the place wasn't full.  Order came quick but the food was mediocre.  Had better some place else.  Pricing is average compared to other places.  Unfortunately, will not be coming back.

I love this place. It is the best and most affordable Vietnamese place in Henderson. Great staff/service and really relaxing atmosphere. I eat here as often as possible and love the happy hour deals! Definitely worth checking out.

Still a fan! The beef stew is a fantastic option for the extra cold weather and a new favorite. Mine came with super tender chunks of beef and some tendon. The Pho Ga seems to be hit or miss, but it can be good. The spicy chicken wings are good and definitely spiiiiiiiiiicy.
I ordered too much.  I guess I am used to some places skimping on ingredients in the vermicelli bowls, but I was stuffed.  very clean,
I have been here many times with my family. We all love it. Great pho and their other dishes are quite good as well. definitely a staple if you live in the area!
This is my favorite local pho place! The inside of the restaurant is always clean and presentable. Very friendly staff and the food is always fresh!
i love their brisket Pho!  Ive never ate at the restaurant but get it "to go" and they always do a great job!  The brisket is fatty and delicious!  I love it, I chop it up and drop it in the soup!

Friendliest, kindly people inside. Clean! Wonderful food. Enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. I am a no carb person and they brought my pho without noodles! That was one reason I had not gone to a pho restaurant before but my sister encouraged me to do so. Glad I did. I will be coming back on a routine basis for fresh delicious food!
The food was delicious. And the waiters were friendly. We loved the pho combination. Worth the drive.
I absolutely love this place! Amazing; Healthy, great food. I highly recommend this place. I'm from Seattle where Vietnamese food is popular; I'm stoked for this kind of restaurant in Vegas.

We were hanging out and running errands in Henderson all day Saturday and worked up a mean appetite. It was 95 degrees out, but that didn't stop our hot bowl of pho cravings! We decided to give this place a try, since most of the yelp reviews were tried and true.   Luckily we came at 4:45pm, just in time for happy hour, which is from 3-5pm (everyday)  This is what we ordered from the happy hour menu: all $5 each  Chao tom (shrimp cake/ shrimp patty) spring rolls - It was 2 rolls cut in half, making it 4 pieces and it was lacking so much! There was a paper thin piece of (chao tom) shrimp patty and it was all lettuce for the most part. The hoisen dipping sauce was tasty, but I just couldn't get past how skimped they were on the rolls. Not worth it, even at the happy hour price of $5. 1/5  Spicy chicken wings - These came out fresh from the fryer in 8 good sized, meaty wings. These were incredibly crispy and saucy! Packed with flavor, salty sweet, and spicy. I love how they were not afraid to pack on the flavor on each wing. Definitely finger lickin' good! 5/5  Pho dac biet (beef special pho) - the broth was good, yet the tendon was not tender and not good cuts. My boyfriend took them all out of his soup since he couldn't eat them - which is odd and not like him at all, since he loves tendon. Yet, for $5 for a small bowl, it's a good deal. 3/5  Pho ga (chicken pho) - the broth was good as well, but I couldn't really enjoy my chicken - they were pretty dry slices. Overall it wasn't the worst pho ga I've ever had and for $5 a bowl, it's still a great deal. 3/5  An hour after dinner we were the thirstiest we've ever been - I felt super dehydrated. As you an imagine, the food was very salty. Oh well, I guess If you want big flavor, you have to expect to be salt-bombed.

This is some pretty good Pho. Didn't want to drive all the way to Chinatown anymore since I live closer to this area now....and thanks to Yelp, I may have found my go-to Pho restaurant.  I'm a creature of habit so I've been ordering Pho Tai since them early high school days. Either that or some kind of Vermicelli bowl....depending on my mood. Pho Tai is good here....although...I've got to say they give you wayyyyy tooo much noodles and not enough beef. I probably got like 5 slices of beef? Is that normal here? $7.50 for a small bowl and I think $8.50+ for a large bowl?  For an appetizer, we got the summer roll. It was my boyfriend's first time eating that and he loved it!!!! You get two rolls...each cut in half. Very light and refreshing.

The summer rolls were well put together with fresh ingredients and the peanut dipping sauce had actual peanut halves that were crunchy in texture. The wait time and ambience were average. The bean sprouts and jalapeños were fresh. I'm used to having mint but experiencing the actual lemongrass was refreshing. I usually judge how good a bowl of pho is by the broth, it was very flavorful and hardly oily, which is a plus since I'm already on a clean diet. The meats tasted fresh, lean, and the actual pieces themselves were more robust than your average bowl in LA. The noodles were perfectly textured and the serving size of a large was perfect. Lastly, the service was stellar. I didn't have to holler to get my glass filled with water or move plates to the side or wait long to get the check. I am definitely coming back to get the bun Bo hue and banh mi.
This place never fails.   Everything is always fresh and tasty.  Love the noodle dishes and of course the Pho soup.  Highly recommend.  Good prices and great food.

For starters....  WHAT THE #@*! HAPPENED TO THIS PLACE?!?!  Our overall experience with this restaurant yesterday was extremely disappointing, especially considering that not long ago (3 months?) it used to be one of our favorites.  And I don't believe they just had a random "bad evening".  First off, the young girl that started off with our table seemed completely lost.  How about some place settings?  How about some menus BEFORE asking what we wanted to order?  Considering we were all drinkers, how about taking a drink order?  Nope, she was just a little robot with zero common sense, zero waitressing skills, and apparently zero interest in doing anything because we never saw her again.  Oh well.  At least the food will be good right?  WRONG!  After awkwardly serving ONE PERSON AT A TIME over a 15-minute period, we finally had our food.  The spring rolls were different than the previous visit and very mediocre.  The vermicelli bowl was barely lukewarm accompanied by very cold soggy lettuce and cold water in the bottom of the bowl.  The vermicelli sauce had changed from our previous visit as well.  It was all edible, but crappy.  I'm giving it one star due to lousy service combined with food that was "edible" at best.  Nobody else in my party was very impressed either.  Supposedly it won a "Best in Las Vegas" award for 2015, but trust me, it will not be winning that award again.  Like I said before, it used to be our favorite.  But after yesterday, I will tell people to avoid it.  There are plenty of other Vietnamese restaurants in this town that blow this one away.

My family's go to Viet place when in Vegas! As a Vietnamese American, I have tried many Vietnamese restaurants everywhere I visit, including little Saigon in California that is the Mecca of Vietnamese food. Pho Mai Lan is delicious and provides a variety of Vietnamese foods. The combination pho is tasty and the soup is flavorful but not too overwhelming. The restaurant is spacious and the staff is good.

My husband and I discovered this place on one rainy Sunday. We were always going to Lemon Grass but wanted to try something different. What I love about this place is the tofu spring rolls...they're huge and delicious!! Their broth is always consistent and hot and service is awesome and the food comes out fast. Glad we found this place.
been here multiple times, food isnt bad!   Had the porkchop rice this time around and it was good! Well made and fresh!

The tempura shrimp is the best I have had any place and the price is right. Beef noodle soup was excellent. Loved the spring rolls.    Have been there 2 times and each time was excellent and will be back.

Quite empty very spacious really great family venue. Had a party of 9 which they easily accommodated.  Parking ample and easy to find.   Items chosen included Eggrolls, shrimp and pork vermicelli, shrimp salad, catfish rice, spicy chicken wings, calamari, sizzling beef, & seafood noodle.   Egg Roll skin was not crispy as I'm used to. Filling not as tasty and condiments cut up a bit rough and wet (carrots not as long stringy for example). Probably wouldn't order that again.   The other items are really good. Shrimp salad it was just perfect with the right touch of sweetness we asked for salad without pork.  Chicken  wings had a wonderful sweetness n spicy tang . Seafood noodle was loaded with seafood. The sizzling beef was a bit on the tough side. Catfish is good. Calamari crunchy n tasty especially with sweet chili. We roll a bit different than American establishments since calamari usually served with lemon.   Thai iced tea is good but please don't stir in the cream for me. I like to see orange and white separation. That's how it's places serve it. I'm a sucker for mainstream normal in some cases.   Total for us $152 (gratuity included  for this large party.)   Million dollar question would we return? Yep we will!
Certainly not my favorite.  Dirty dishes everywhere including all the way back to the bathrooms.  Food did not taste as freshly made as other places.

This used to be our family's spot! I don't know what happened but it makes me sad. I'll give it a 2 because the food really is delicious but the service has declined in the past year. The service used to be so much better but now I have to flag the waitresses and employees down to ask for a refill of water, the check, silverware etc. It's like after they got voted "Best Vietnamese food in Las Vegas" they stopped giving a f@$k. Ever since I think it was the manager guy with the hoop earrings left its just been on a steady downward slope.  Today I literally had to get up and stand there and wave for someone to come to our table. I also asked our waitress to split the check between my friend while we placed our order but she still brought one check, after I addressed it, there were excuses instead of an apology which was disappointing. Pho MaiLan your food is delicious but you all need to work on customer service. We've been coming faithfully to MaiLan since it opened but after today I think I'm done. The service there used to be UH-mazing and it shocks me that it declined so rapidly. There are so many delicious pho spots in Vegas I'm sure we won't have an issue finding another favorite. Deuces MaiLan

We finally found our new favorite Vietnamese restaurant. Great ambiance, friendly service. The food is tasty!  Been to 2 other Vietnamese restaurants and this one is the best. Tried B1 - Combo Vermicelli bowl & P13 - Seafood Pho. Love it!  We will be back!

I love this place! Its so clean and inviting & the staff is always nice and Professional.  And the food is delicious! I always get the Pho and mmmmm :) so yummy! I would recommend all of my friends and family here!

This place is great and the staff is super friendly.  I'm no Pho expert, and they're more than willing to answer questions about the many options on the menu.   It's really delicious and I'll be returning often.  Oh!  If you show up in the afternoons (3pm-5pm I think?) it's happy hour, and a bowl is only $5!
Excellent Pho is a nice atmosphere!  Delicious!! Generous portions, clean tasting and good prices.  It's in a quiet part of town in Henderson on south Eastern Ave. I highly recommend this place.

Pho Malin.. I am in love with this restaurant, I just wish only two things, one you would adjust your prices for vegetarian food items and meat items, no way I should be charged the same for a Summer Roll that has zero meat in it compared to the ones that have all kinds of meat in it, makes no since and then second open a location in Henderson!! I need you everyday!  Pho Malin, you are amazing, your Pho is one of the best. I placed my order to go and they gave me the best amount of sides I have received from any Pho location, the to go box came with a large amount of chicken and broth only thing I was unsure of was did they not give me enough noodles or did I eat them all too fast? The amount of  broth  remaining was crazy! Love me some Pho with Lime! And Mint and Soy Sauce.. yummmm.. I will be back tomorrow!  Priced at about $10 for the Pho And $6.50 for the Fresh Summer Roll Veggie style .. since they charge the same with meat I always ask for my shrimp on the side!! (Hence the bag of shrimp in the photo)

Well I gotta admit I am kind of a pho junkie.  My gf is half vietnamese so we are always hitting up the local places to get our fix.  Beings she is half vietnamese, and her family has some awesome cooks, I tend to know if the pho is good or just mmmmhhhh.  Pho MaiLan I really enjoy.  I have been here about 8 times or so and have gotten various things on the menu.  Unlike other pho places where the broth is really bland and very blah, pho mailan you can really taste the spices they use.  The eggrolls are yummy too.   The sandwiches I get occasionally to go for lunch tomorrow, but I would have to say that they aren't 5 star, maybe 3.  All in all its yummy, the staff is friendly, and it has free wi-fi for my entertainment pleasure.  :)
Came here for lunch today food was really good... I tell you the water here is amazing.. lol

Service is like any other Vietnamese restaurant.  They have pretty good egg rolls 4/5* Pho is 2/5* broth wasn't really rich and full of beef bone flavors. Vermicelli bowls 2/5* the noodles were hard... like old, cold noodles.  I asked for a bottled water, the kid said he didn't have any then pulled one out of a hat and handed it to me. It was hot with crud stuck all over it and bent... what The heck? Where did you really pull this out of?!  And why the hell did you even give it to me?  I handed it back to him. Thanks but no thanks.
Not worth the wait.  Not even close to "Best Vietnamese Food".  The grilled pork in my banh mi was tough. The bread and the vegetables seemed dry and lacked dressing/sauce to keep it together.

This is the first time I had bad customer service. I ordered a bowl of pho, instead the vermichelli I got the egg noodles. When I took that first bite of egg noodles it was soggy and the texture is bad. I was thinking dang these egg noodles must be old. So I ask the lady if I can exchange the egg noodles to vermichelli, she was like no the noodles are usually like that. In my mind, I'm like hell no the noodles was suppose to be a little hard.

I went here with a group of 8 and we were seated pretty fast. Although their prices are little more expensive then back where I'm from ($10-12pp). The portions are TINY for what you get. Their large is a regular here.... It tasted pretty good comparing to the Pho places here since I'm from the San Gabriel Valley. However, I guess things are more expensive and smaller portions out in Henderson....It would be a place to stop by if you want some authentic Vietnamese food in this area though! One thing I'm really happy with was the fact that our server gave us the option to split our bill individually before we even considered it! That was a plus since their menu said 18% service fee for parties of 6 or more.
Excellent. I love Asian food and it was delicious. Appetizers are very good (summer rolls) and the ban mi sandwiches are to try !!!
