We first tried this place when it opened a couple of years back and hadnt been back until tonight. We were contemplating picking up from Pho Saigon 8 but thought why not get from closer to home (about 5 minutes)? I have to say, very glad we gave this place a second chance.    Had 2 large orders of pho tai (rare steak) 8.00 each and an order of springs rolls (fried egg rolls) 6.00 for 4 rolls. I have to say the amount of noodles and beef was way more than my husband and I could finish! I am a very hearty eater by the way...Our large bowls at home were about to overflow with all the food and I actually didnt eat all of the noodles. Each of us had about 12 pieces of steak, which is generous.   The broth was still boiling hot and when we poured it over the beef and noodles, the meat cooked instantly. The soup was flavorful, not overly oily and really hit the spot. the spring rolls were average, no worse or better than other pho places we've tried. It does seem though maybe take out is the way to go!   The only downside was the green leaf lettuce that you wrap the spring rolls in was a little wilted and brown along the edges. Had they been really fresh, it would have almost been 5 stars. We will order from them again!

Second time having takeout here and it has officially become our go-to pho place. I got their "special" mi xao don with seafood. I'm glad only family was around for dinner because I'm actually kind of embarrassed at how fast I stuffed this in my face. It's just that yummy. Fast, friendly service. They don't screw up the order. Good prices. We love them

We've always had a good experience every time we go to Vegas. This is the spot of choice for authentic and tasty pho. We usually get the combination pho and chicken wings and spring rolls. It is always consistently good. I can't complain. The service is reasonable even though at times they seem a little understaffed. We still get our food without waiting very long.

Solid Pho, my wife loves Pho and uses all the ingredients provided and she is a fan as well. I enjoy getting Pho Mailan Post mated to our house, it's a reliable solid soup option. I'm a plain eater I like the broth, noodles and handful of ingredients. I'm always down to eat here

Good Service and Good Food.  Mom and I went here the other night because we wanted something hot and simple... and Pho seemed like a good idea.  This was our first visit to this restaurant and we were happy with it.  We didn't order anything unusual... we were pretty boring in our selections.  So we'll go back and try something different next time.  Spring rolls... fresh and tasy.  I really like the peanut dipping sauce, very creamy.  If you like it spicy... add some chili garlic sauce to it like I did which punched it up nicely.  Chicken Pho.... quick and hot.  The broth was not oily like I've read in the other reviews so I'm wondering if maybe it's because chicken doesn't have much fat?  The Pho was good... not much to it until I added the bean sprouts, jalapenos, lime, basil and hot sauce.  Mine had lots of chicken in it so I was happy.  We each ordered a "Regular" and it was more than we could finish.

I ordered the tofu pho and it was good except there were only 3 small pieces of pho in there. I also prefer the pho fried so that is why this didn't get 5 stars. It would have been better with more tofu and with it cooked. The service was phenomenal!!!

My first time ever having phô was here about 4 years ago on a date with my partner. We have been coming here ever since. The food is delicious and the service is efficient and above par. We always have to have the shrimp fried rice with either the spring rolls or eggrolls. On top of the usual seafood phô and spicy beef noodle soup. Amazing!! We have not had a bad experience here (ok maybe once but that was many years ago and we blame it on shark week) please enjoy this hidden gem

This place was recommended so I stopped in after work 1 night. I ordered 2 bowls, chicken satay and pork fried rice. I ordered the food to go and did not have to wait long. The staff were very friendly.  The food was a disappointment. The satay lacked flavor as did the Pho. The rice was ok but the beef in our bowls was primarily fat and gristle. On top of that it was expensive. We will not return.

I tended to like it here.  The food came quickly, and the service was nice and friendly.  We had a great young girl helping us most of the time who really made sure we had everything we needed, and explained any dishes we weren't sure about.  As far as food quality goes, white it certainly wasn't the best pho I've ever had, it's entirely okay when I'm craving pho and don't want to drive very far from my house.  As usual with Vietnamese restaurants, I'm always disappointed when banh mi isn't on the menu, but not every place can be a banh mi place!

Pho Mailan was very clean and modern, compared to most. Service was good and prompt, while the food spoke for itself. Ordered Pho Ga, Pho Bo, Sweet and Sour Popcorn Chicken, Pork and Beef Sandwhich, Chicken Satay, Veggie Rolls, Egg Rolls & Spicy Beef Soup. Every dish was DELICIOUS! My Son loved the iced coffee, he ordered 2! Great/healthy fast food. A definite MUST TRY!

I guess i've followed the majority of yelpers here as I am a fan of the Bun Bo Mai Lan. Spicy but not over bearing and the I licked the bowl dry bc the soup was so scrumcious.   For me the location is far but for anyone who lives in the east side this is a must!   If this were in Chinatown I'd go all the time especially since the service is akin to any non-Asian spot. It's a nice added touch to be treated nicely although what's most important is the quality of the food which they definitely do not short in.  Oh yah it's also clean too!

Sometimes you wander around on Yelp and you stumble across hidden gems in your own neighborhood, this is the case with me and Pho MaiLan.  If not for Yelp, I would never know about it even though it's just half a block from my favorite Trader Joe's.  I see a lot of potential in Pho MaiLan, mostly due of their Bun Bo Hue, the Vietnamese spicy beef noodle soup, the less known cousin of Pho but definitely the more fitting noodle soup for cold weather.  It's made with a richer beef broth with a subtle hint of lemongrass flavor, a more hearty rice vermicelli, and filling proteins such as beef shank, pork hock, beef tendon & pork blood.  It's a favorite among Vietnamese but difficult to make well, and thus I haven't had a very good bowl since moving to Vegas from Orange County.  Pho MaiLan's version is very tasty without being too fatty, something that I've rarely found in Vegas.  I'm giving it a three stars only because tonight's bowl was missing a couple of things to be authentic: there was no pork blood; also, banana blossom and shredded cabbage should be served as the accompanying veggies but they ran out of banana blossom this evening.    My fiance had Pho, it was good, not the best Pho broth in Vegas but it had a good amount of meat and the beef's quality was very good.  We also had egg rolls for appetizers.  The egg rolls were good; however, I was disappointed because I read from Yelp that the restaurant had Banh Beo (floating rice cakes with shrimp) but they also ran out of that tonight.    On a positive note, the service is great, the waitresses were very friendly and attentive.  The restaurant's atmosphere is cheery and clean (all the sauce bottles seem to be filled and cleaned often).  The Bun Bo is still the best one in Vegas so far for me, but I'm looking forward to a more complete version next time.
The service was okay. The Pho could have been better.  The french bread was yummy.  If you are craving good soup, go down the street to Pho Saigon 8...
Our favorite Vietnamese Restaurant!!! I love their fresh summer roll with peanut sauce! Everything here taste good!
Great place go pho. It always hot and fresh. The beef broth is delicious and they are generous with the meat portions.
This is my go to place in Henderson for Vietnamese food. Food has been consistent, service is good, and clean.
Not the best place for pho, id honestly rather drive down a bit further to go to pho Saigon. This is not authentic Vietnamese.

I ordered the lemongrass chicken and I ate two bites and was done. I thought if I took another bite, I wouldn't be able to keep it down. My husband, who eats anything, wouldn't eat it either. The chicken tasted like it's pre cooked and reheated.  All I could think of was that this place should be on kitchen nightmares. The plastic on the bench seat was split. The walls and floor need a good cleaning. I will NEVER go back.   I will admit that I am a picky eater and I hate complaining in restaurants. We paid $30 for two meals and ate two bites of mine and about 5 bites of my husbands. We paid and left full plates on the table. I couldn't get out of there fast enough!

Food was just ok.  Beef noodle soup was very oily and chunks of fat in it. Shrimp dish over crispy noodles was pretty good.  The servers here REALLY need some training though.  Food was brought out and we were on our own.....nobody to check if it was ok....offer more drinks...nothing.  However as soon as we had finished eating - the bill was dropped on the table.  (forget about offering us dessert or coffee) - basically 'please pay your bill and leave'.  They didn't even bother to clear our meal dishes away until we left.  I wanted to take some of the leftovers home and we were handed a plastic container and struggled to get the soup into it without dumping it all over the table.  They weren't busy so some help would have been nice.  Strange place.  For those prices I expect more.
Great service even when getting take out!! I wasn't sure about some wordings but he educated me on different meats to make sure I got what I wanted!!

I've been trying to decide whether to give this place four or five stars and it's a pretty close call. Last night was my first time at Pho Mailan as I'm new to the area. My first impression was a good one; clean, airy, comfortable atmosphere. Service was quick and I had nothing to complain about. There also seemed to be a lot of regulars which is always a good sign. The broth was fragrant and light, and was topped with plenty of greens and vegetables which I love. Pho is one of my favorite things ever, so I've had quite a bit in my day. I like to feel good about myself when I eat Pho, so I'm bummed when I get broth that is dark and oily and I feel disgusting afterwards. This had none of those qualities so I am assuming they don't use MSG, can't swear to it since I'm not an expert, but I felt nothing but happy about having a belly full of hot soup. My only complaint is that they only have two sizes for Pho... I would be thrilled to see an extra large on the menu. I also didn't see an "extras" section on the menu where you can double up on meat, get add on's etc., but I will definitely be asking the next time I go for Pho because I'll be back for sure.

So I love this place and I know I recently gave a high rating but I am really disappointed with the level of service I got here when my daughter and I went in again. I was ignored as we stood there to be greeted. We sat ourselves and got a menu then it was a good 10 minutes until someone came to take my order. I tried finding my server or someone to wave down as we didn't receive any napkins or anything to drink the whole meal. I was done at this point and finally got someone to pack my food up. She disappeared and I don't know where my food went? The trash??

Decided last minute to go get some Vietnamese. We were sat right away. The service was very attentive. I ordered a veggie pho, which was very good.  Close to home and tasty, and unlike most Vietnamese restaurants, the service was good.
This restaurant has the best Vietnamese food in all of Las Vegas. The service is fast and friendly and always delivers quality on a consistent basis.

I came here for lunch and ordered the chicken and egg roll vermicelli bowl with a glass of unsweetened iced tea (I didn't specify what kind of tea, expecting the usual restaurant fare of black tea, and received a tasty glass of jasmine which complimented the meal quite well). Our server was very friendly and our food was brought to the table quickly, the dishes mixed by our server right at the table. The food itself was scrumptious, and there was far more of it than either of us expected for the price. All in all, an excellent lunch experience.

My boyfriend thinks their fried rice is the best is ever eaten. I love their pho and the spring rolls. I feel like they up their prices because of the location, but it's our go to when we are having a lazy night and want some grub. I love the decoration.

What a fantastic restaurant! Our first time experiencing Pho. Eric was very kind and understanding. He explained the proper way to order as well eat Pho. Thank you for everything we will definitely be back and spread the word of the wonderful Pho, atmosphere and staff.

One of the best pho restaurants in town.  The waiters and waitresses are so friendly!  The decor is clean and modern, and it is one of those rare places where the food you order comes out looking just as nice as it does in the menu photos.  The tofu spring rolls are delicious, as is the grilled chicken and rice dish. Great food, good prices, excellent service, and a nice atmosphere.  You really can't go wrong with Pho Mailan.
Went last week because I was craving Banh MI. Got the Banh Mi combo. Good price, good quality. The service was very friendly. I would go back. It's a nice little place.

I've only been twice but both times have been enjoyable and the food is very good! I really like the satay chicken and spring rolls... the Pho is pretty good going up against all the other places... this place has a great fresh smell too- which is nice when you're eating! I highly recommend it!

This is hands down the BEST pho I've had.   A while back I asked my Vietnamese friend where he goes for good pho, and he told me Pho Mailan is his favorite. I've been hooked ever since. I drive by 5 pho places on the way to Mailan, but I wouldn't even consider going to any of the others. I took my parents there, and now they take all their friends there. I usually eat there about twice a week.   We've tried almost all the appetizers and haven't found anything we don't like yet. I always get the P10, chicken pho. It's the only place I've been to that serves thick, white meat chicken in their pho. No dark meat or gristle ever!  That's the main reason I only go to Pho Mailan.   It's clean and nicely decorated inside. The staff is polite, especially the owner. He takes a lot of pride in his food. Prices are reasonable, especially now that they offer $5 pho during happy hour from 3-5pm.
My favorite literally eat there once a week. They close early so take out is a must. Coconut water fur hangovers and Thai tea for a quick buzz!! Veggie egg rolls all day!!

Excellent customer service. But the pho and summer rolls lack flavor. Also, rice noodles. Rice noodles everywhere. Too much rice noodles. It's a cheap, tasteless filler.  Five stars for the customer service.  One star for the food.  I'll stick to Lemongrass Cafe.

I had my first experience with Pho this past Friday here and it will probably be my last. The other reviewers must all be friends of the owners because the specialty soup was just nasty. The staff was very nice and polite but I'm not sure what they tried to serve me. I posted a photo of the soup to hundreds of people through Facebook and  all the comments stated that  they never seen anything like that before even when they ate Pho Vietnam.   Take a look at my photo. That is actually the hoof or snout of some animal in my soup and my GFs as well. I have attached a picture so you can see.  The photo speaks for itself.   Sorry Pho MaiLan. I so wanted to give you a good review, and I just raised the the amount of stars I gave you specifically for your good customer service and for asking us to come back and try something that may not be so daring for first timers.

Wow, Everything we ordered was wrong including the drinks! The Pho was bland, the chicken was dry, and waiter was rude.  I've been a fan of Vietnamese for a long time and have eaten all over North America, this is by far the worst Vietnamese I have ever had by far. Something is very wrong here.

I've had trouble finding a really good Vietnamese restaurant in terms of both quality of food and service. Many Oriental places have fairly surly or indifferent service (I can say this because I'm Oriental) but Pho MaiLan was outstanding on both counts. We had roasted chicken on rice and short ribs on rice, as well as incredible shrimp paste and smoked salmon rice paper salad rolls.  The service was very attentive and not too busy even on a Friday night - it's a little bit of a drive from central Henderson (being near Horizon Ridge  Parkway on Eastern) but it's worth it. My wife and I will be back soon;.

The food here is really good. We've tried various items and haven't been disappointed in the many times we've visited. The 4 stars is because of the service. They're a bit inattentive. All the times we've come in (which were not busy times), our servers don't check up on us after receiving our meals and the wait for our check would be about 15-20 mins maybe more unless we flag someone down. Other than that small nitpick, I'd recommend this restaurant for great Vietnamese food.

Its Pho - so you know its yummy!!  Which is the only thing this place has going for it.  Staff.  I actually think they are fem-bots.  They dont speak.  They just kinda grunt.  ZERO customer engagement!!  Caution:  watch your veggies!!  Often they are slimy & wilted.   The meat portions are minuscule.    Bottom line:  if the sun & moon all align & the veggies are healthy and a few extra slivers of meat fall into your bowl your meal will be tasty!
My favorite pho restaurant I probably eat here 3 times per week everything is yummy and staff is wonderful
What a great place! Customer service was excellent, very attentive. My Pho was delicious, best I've had! Will definitely come here again.

Several times that hubby and I have been back, the broth is still as delicious as the first time we had it.  However, the meat quality has gone down.  The meatball tasted like it was freezer burned.  After one bite, I fished out the meatballs and dumped it.  Just a couple of days ago, I decided to get the chicken pho in beef broth, to go.  When we got home, I opened the box and took the slices of chicken out and lo and behold, the slices of chicken must have just got taken out of the freezer!  There were some frost on them.  Hubby and I are very disappointed as this is our go-to for a nice bowl of pho.  I don't know when is the next time we will come back, but for now, it will be on our maybe list.

Really nice Vietnamese place! I ordered pho tai and fresh spring rolls while my friend ordered some kind of stew with baguette on the side. We both loved our meals!!! Delicious Vietnamese food! The place was also very laid back and easy going. They have lots of customers but there's always enough staff and they're attentive for whatever you need! Food comes fast as well! Will definitely come back to this place! I've also tried them from DoorDash/Grubhub and orders are pretty consistent and I love how cheap it is!!! Thai tea is very good as well!

We haven't had Pho for a long time. This place was close to where we were staying so we decided to give it a try. We were very happy with the food. Summer Rolls were light and crispy and the Pho was hot and very flavorful. Not so salty like we've had many other places.  We'll be back the next time we're in town.
The service is always friendly and the food is great!  I've never seen it very busy either.

I think I found my calling I love there Pho/soup. I've been there three times this week the place and the food are impeccable as you walk in you feel the cleanliness of the place the welcoming staff. It's an experience this place is really the best one.
Best Pho we have found in Vegas!  Always friendly service, and the restaurant is very clean.  Also try the tofu spring rolls and a Vietnamese coffee (unique and much better than regular coffee!)
The best Pho I ever had and I love the atmosphere as well. It's up the street from my house and price is very reasonable. My new favorite place for Pho!

My husband and I used to come here frequently and then stepped in one day during winter to find the place freezing. It was so cold the waiter was wearing a hat and gloves, we could barely enjoy our meal. Our waiter told us the owner refused to put the heat on higher. Fast forward to a couple weekends ago we were down the street and decided to try this place out again, this time there was a family complaining to the owner about how hot it was and they stated" we tell you this all the time in the summer and winter you need to fix the temperature or people will leave" . The owner did not seem phased at all by this. Nonetheless I could barely eat my meal it was so hot in there. The biggest pro they have is their varied appetizer list compared to most other pho restaurants. However they aren't all that.

If you're in Henderson Seven Hills area, and love pho, this is the place to go. I've lost count how many times I've been here to satisfy my pho cravings, but I swear it got better with each and every visit. The combination bowl is worth every penny. There are two sizes available, regular and large. Unlike many other places, when you order a larger bowl, they don't just fill it with more broth. Pho Mailan fills it with more meat, noodles, and everything else to make the $1 difference completely worth it.   Their appetizers are a bit on the pricier side ($6 for an order of spring rolls is a bit expensive), and that automatically docks one star from my review. But nonetheless, the food is great, the owners are very polite and courteous, and I can guarantee you won't leave dissatisfied.
Amazing soups. Broth is incredible!  Ba mi sandwiches were a bit of a dissapointment- I did not enjoy their style of bread, maybe others will.

I ordered a small pho with round steak, well done flank, and tendon. The portion size was pretty big for a "small" size and I thought there was plenty of meat included. We did stop by on a Monday night, so the service was quick and the waitresses were very nice! Unlike other reviewers' experiences, the broth was hot and I enjoyed my bowl of pho at Pho MaiLan!

Being Vietnamese, my palette was craving my native food. I stumbled across Pho MaiLan, which seemed to have excellent reviews, so I decided to try it out. Unfortunately, I was disappointed. I felt it was essentially the "Panda Express" of Vietnamese food, absent the Vietnamese flavors that I look for in a traditional dish. This is not to say that the food was not tasty; my point here is only that it lacks authenticity.

Had high hopes with this place after seeing pretty good reviews, however I just picked up a to go order, a single Pho Tai order and the beef was raw, which is normal, but it was also FROZEN. Needless to say, since it was frozen it didn't cook in the hot broth, it instead just made my broth cold. I had to heat it up on my stove in order for it to be edible. I guess when you call in an order for pick up, make sure you specify you don't want your meat frozen. I have it 2 stars instead of 1, because despite the frozen meat, after heating properly and eating the broth was very good.

Every visit I have made to this establishment has been wonderful. Friendly staff, excellent food. I never leave disappointed; just maybe a bit too full if I can't stop myself from polishing off everything ordered.   My favorites are the shrimp cake roll and any of the beef pho. Must have beverage of my choice is the iced ginger tea.  Highly recommend that you stop in and try some of the fantastic food, especially during happy hour which begins at 3!
I love pho' n this place is clean n affordable n good location too not far from my house either

We love this place this is our favorite new place for pho.  Fantastic lunch place and great deal $5 for a bowl of pho.  I would of giving it five stars except during dinner hours they do get quite busy and they lack in service.
Some of the best phò I've had in Vegas! Amazing broth. Great casual atmosphere and attentive service. Also a great price point. $7.50 for small phò and 8.50 for large. Also great appetizers!
A great place to go when you are in need for a nice warm bowl of pho to beat the cold. They use fresh veggies and they service is good too!

I've tried many different pho places and this one is by far the worst I've ever been to. I was really craving some pho after moving out here from Cali but I was completely disappointed. The broth wasn't hot, the soup didn't have any taste to it and the combination pho is waaay overpriced for a small bowl. If you're looking for good pho, I suggest Pho Saigon 8 which is down by north eastern - best pho ever.

Good Bun Bo Hue! Came here after a long night at the clubs with my girls... That first sip of soup was very satisfying... it wasn't too spicy, but had good flavor to the soup. I could taste the lemon grass and the pork bones. Only thing i didnt think was that the noodles were waaaaay overcooked, to the point there the noodles were all broken in my bowl :(  Others got the pho, which they seemed to like, and some got the pho ga and it seemed ok. Kind of plain tbh.   A bowl of noodles will cost you around 8-9 dollars. The spring rolls were pricey though, 6 dollars for 2 small rolls cut in half :(   I think I might come back though next time I'm in Vegas!
Delicious!!!! My husband and I tried this place one night on a whim and it's awesome!!!! We have been back since then with our friends. Food is amazing, great customer service, and good prices!!!

I usually always order phö from here and I've never been disappointed until now. I order a large portion of pho and received less than a handful of noodles. Ridiculous. Plus they forgot the cilantro and my veggie bag had maybe 15 bean sprouts and wilted basil. Time to find a new place to get phö.
Quick and consistent. Best Pho in this neck of the woods.

Excellent experience from the moment we stepped in to the restaurant. We were greeted with open tables and smiling faces of the workers and were immediately sat at a table. Very friendly workers all throughout the restaurant.  For appetizers we got the fried calamari, which were all rings and not the legs. My favorite! Served with a sweet chili sauce for dipping. We had no problem finishing that.   I got a small vegetable pho, the veggies included were tofu, broccoli and carrots. Bean sprouts & basil served on the side. The small portion was just right for me, I finished everything in my bowl except for some soup.   I also got to try the special spicy pho. I liked the spice level and the only thing different was the noodles. It was a little more thick than the one in the pho, but noodles are noodles in my opinion.  Thank you to the staff for being so friendly & accommodating on our first visit here. Definitely be back to try something new.

Absolutely love this place. Been coming here for nearly 3 years and it is the best Pho in town. The employees are always great and the bossman is a real charmer! I love it here. It's worth the 20+ mile drive for some amazing service and delicious food!

Apparently we came in the wrong driveway and we're going all over the parking lot looking for the address.  We finally found it and when we went up to the door it was dark. The door was open so we went in and discovered we were coming in from the back door.  LOL.  We were quickly greeted and seated.  Ordered the chicken and shrimp vermicelli noodles (bun) and a pork combo banh mi.  Food came quick and smelled great.  Had 3 good size shrimp grilled to perfection.  The bun was good along with the grilled chicken breast.  Hubby thought his banh mi was a bit salty but ate it nevertheless.  Lots of customers were getting the pho.  The pho comes in regular and large size.  The bowls looked huge.  The servers do not smile but I didn't care as the food made up for it.  Clean place and reasonable prices.   After a long hiatus, it was time to get some bun and a banh mi.  We are visiting Vegas and getting our fill of Asian cuisine.  Greeted and seated immediately.  The server also came to take our order immediately but we hadn't even opened the menu!  Our waters came while we reviewed the menu.  We ordered the chicken and egg roll bun and the combo banh mi (Marinated Grilled pork and beef, and steamed pork).  Service was quick and our food arrived.  We both enjoyed our meals although hubby said the meats were rather salty and the banh mi could have included more daikon and carrots.  Very clean environment.  We'll come back.

Really good Vietnamese food in Henderson. Service is quick.   Ordered the egg rolls, C7 marinated chicken and C11 Shaking beef. Really fresh and great flavor in all dishes.   Also had the honey ginger iced tea and limeade with club soda.   Food was good and came out fast. They have a happy hour for different appetizers for $5 each that I would come back to try.
The pho was up there with the best I've had! Hot, rich broth with great depth of flavor. Service good, nice clean place.
Fantastic service with friendly smiling staff from the moment I walked in. Atmosphere is bright and clean. Incredibly fast service with deliciously fresh flavors. So worth the drive!

The pho broth here is amazing! I can't wait to come back and try more. The only thing I don't want again is there hot jasmine tea. The tea probably didn't steep enough to have any flavor. But the amazing pho broth well out weighs the not so good tea. Service was pretty good and the restaurant was very nice on the inside.
Love Pho Mailan! The chicken pho is the perfect comfort food and the combo Bahn mi is delicious! My son really likes the egg rolls! The restaurant is very nice inside and the service is great :)
Pho lacked flavor and pricey! Had so much better in the valley. Nothing special to write about with the other dishes.

This place is legit.   Another recommendation by a friend who happens to be a local.  Dropped by with friends for a quick bite before going to the movies. We didn't have much time so we tried to rush the whole process.   We ordered everything in one go. 4 appetizers (3 rolls and shrimp skewer), pho for friends and the usual vermicelli for me.   The regular spring roll was decent, but the pork belly one was bananas. Had we had a little extra time I would've ordered another one for myself. It was so good.   The bbq beef vermicelli I had was hands down THE best I've had. Meat wise anyway. That was perfectly cooked and flavored  The service was also fantastic. I'm used to getting shitty service at Asian establishments since it's typically the norm. This place was a different story. They were attentive and on it.   I

Was looking for a new place, and definitely found one! I ordered spring rolls (summer rolls) and a shrimp vermicelli bowl. Unfortunately they didn't have alternatives to meat broth (I can't have that), but I enjoyed my vermicelli dish. My friend liked the beef pho though! Wonderful service!
Guys, this is probably the best Vietnamese food I've ever had in the country. Staff is friendly and food tastes great--we ordered spicy wings, pho and banh mi!!!!!! Try them out sometime!
The Pho Ga was excellent, our other order with beef was too fatty but also good. Servers very friendly at 11 am. Will try the spicy wings and pork chops another time

The Spicy Chicken Wings (aka Canh Ga Chien Nuoc Mam) are pretty close to our home style recipe.  I loved that they don't over batter the wings.  It's still crispy and piping hot when they bring it to you.  The sauce that goes on them has garlic, chilly, fish sauce, sugar, and love.  They offer this too during Happy Hour.  Yay!  If I'm in town, this is the place to get my fix on Vietnamese wings.  Credit due to my friend's referral to this spot.  Thankful and compliments to the chiefs.

This place is my new favorite to go for chicken Ga soup. This stuff is so addicting to eat its like eating a whole bad of  doritios , you can't stop. I have not tried anything else because this soup is so full of flavor. Friendly staff and fast service for takeout.

So I was up at Anthem visiting my sis.  Spent summer years (8) and finally college in Vegas and have seen so many good Vietnamese places come and go over the years.  Hard to find back in the 80's, but now so many.  Coming from So. Cal.  I take pride in knowing good Pho, vermicelli, and banh mi, especially as a white boy, hailing from the SGV.  Pho 79, Golden Deli, love it.  Pho MaiLan literally opened the day before and they did great.  Despite the economic climate, I was totally pulling for them.  The food and service was great.  I stop in every few weeks when I go visit sis.  Encourage you all to check it out!

I was expecting this pho restaurant to look just like any other pho places here in vegas but I was pretty intrigued by the modern cute look of it inside.   We started of with fried egg rolls which tasted typically like any other egg rolls you get anywhere else (yummy) then we ordered Bahn Mi Dac Biet (Vietnamese sandwich) and Pho Dac Biet. The pho was pretty good that's probably for the most part why I gave this place a 5 star and also the look of the restaurant and good service.   I would definitely come back.

Usually when u go somewhere 1 thing is good and the rest is okay. But I ordered combo pho, fried kalamari and spring rolls. All good! Excellent service as well. I've been to a lot of pho places in Hawaii and this one was amazing.

A go-to for pho in Henderson!   I always think to order something different from their menu, but their special pho is delicious and I always end up ordering it.    Generous meat portions, love their meatballs, and definitely, recommend happy hour food selections and enjoy their Vietnamese beer.

I loved the food here! The grilled chicken in my vermicelli bowl was so tender and the fish sauce tasted wonderful- all veggies were super fresh.    I had the pho the next day and it was perfect! I switched out rice noodles for glass noodles.    Will def go back next time I'm in Nevada.

Service has been much better than the first time I have been here (Valentine's day 2015).  The food quality is consistent.  Their pho broth is good, and noodles cooked perfectly.  I ordered a pho with round and meatballs, and got round and tendon instead.  It was corrected immediately with a fresh hot bowl with the correct meats and soup.  This is my go to pho place here in Vegas.  I have been here many times.  Always fast, clean, and consistent.

Pho restaurants are few and far between in Henderson, but if you don't want to drive out to Spring Mountain, this place could do the trick.  I finally decided to try Pho MaiLan for an early lunch under just that circumstance. I'm not convinced that they have Vietnamese ownership, but they do have a typical menu of appetizers, rice dishes, noodle dishes, and of course everyone's favorite Vietnamese beef noodle soup.  For me, it was straight to the Pho Chin Nam ($8.50 for my large bowl). The broth is fairly light on spices and flavor, but there was a passable amount of green onion and cilantro, and the meat had the tenderness and flavor that I expected. They didn't give enough Thai basil for two people and the bean sprouts weren't completely fresh, but the lime wedges and jalapeños were nice (although I didn't find that the lime helped the broth much this time). Gotta appreciate the plastic chopsticks instead of bamboo when you can get them too.  This could easily be 3 stars in another city or circumstance, but I enjoyed my meal enough that I'd give Pho MaiLan another shot some time. Call it "3.5 stars rounded up" if you will. It's a good enough soup with most of the elements of pho that it'd work in a pinch (namely the situation of not being in California).

We like this place.  After moving to the area, we have probably eaten here more than any other local place.  As others have mentioned, some of the food is a little plain but the ingredients seem high quality and some of it is quite good.  As for the more moderately good things we have eaten there, it might just be that we have grown to prefer the depth of flavors that you find in Thai food over Vietnamese food, which seems a litte tamer.  But we still like Vietnamese food.  Also, we're not usually beef eaters, so we can't comment on that part of the menu which might well be the best part.  What keeps us returning is that the relationship between price and what you get is very good.  Staff/owners are very friendly, place is clean, seating always available although there is a steady stream of people coming and going including some getting take-out, and the food is always at least good if not great.  I'm not sure of where else (at a restaurant with table service, anyway) we could get two main courses, an appetizer, and two hot teas, leave a 20% tip, and have spent less than $30 for two people.  We'll be back, probably fairly regularly.
Absolutely pho-tastic!!! Everything on the menu is fabulous.  Plus they deliver!!

The BF loves his PHO - not more than he loves me though- (let's hope) anyways, he told me that he spotted a Pho place in our area and was dieing to try it...So after weeks of saying not today I finally gave in. My first impression was that it was clean and decorated cute-it had a boutique feel to it. Which in my book was cool... On to the food-in the menu it looks like all of the Pho contains beef with the exception of one (chicken) but when we asked the nice waitress she said that for $1.00 more they can put shrimp instead of beef-Cool!!!  -Iced Tea: Be aware that it is lightly colored yellow (like pee) and has an extra light taste so light that it just about tasted like my water. The waitress said it was a green tea not black and that it was meant to be healthy and have a clean taste-the BF loved it. -Cha Gio (Crispy spring rolls): This dish is what determines for me if I want to return or not. In Guam these spring rolls are huge and full of clear noodles,tiny bits of pork and veggies and flavored with lots of black pepper-hella good, I miss it. I'm always trying to find a place that sells something similar.This dish is served with big lettuce leaves for you to wrap the egg rolls in and pickled carrots/daikon(could've been pickled longer) to add with fish sauce to dip-These were OK - I hardly saw noodles and I would like them bigger-but still yummy.. -Com Thit Nuong (Thin sliced grilled marinated pork): This dish comes with rice and cucumbers,lettuce and a sliced tomato- there is never any sauce for the salad in Vietnamese Restrauants- The pork was really yummy-it was marinated well and finger lickin good however I didn't like my rice-I am so picky with my rice and I don't like seeing the bottom of the pot in the middle of my rice-I want my rice shiny white and this scoop of rice didn't do it for me... -Pho Ga(Chicken broth): This comes with rice noodles,shredded chicken,and lots of green oinons. I liked the broth, I thought it had just the right amount of seasoning-so soothing on a cold night... -Pho Tai(with shrimp instead): The BF absolutly loves his Pho no matter where we're at-he adds his siracha sauce,limes,and basil and he's in heaven-so yes he loved this dish. I like that this location is close to home and not jammed packed so that we feel like sardines like at other Pho places. I think we will be back again....

I come here for the Pho and the good service...I've been to other Pho restaurants in the Henderson area and service is just terrible.. Pho Mailan..the employees are nice and helpful with ordering when you're trying something new..nice flat screen on the wall, so dinners have been great while watching a game on TV.
The server Paul is awesome! He was very attentive. The pho was terrible! Probably the worst I've ever had. How can you mess up on pho? Three stars for exceptional service!
This place is clean and they are very attentive to the customer, especially if you let them know that it's your first time having this. So tasty!!!!!! I'm definitely coming back!

We were looking for a place to grab a bite to eat before we left good old Las Vegas, yelped pho and it brought us here.  The A/C wasn't working that well, still a little warm inside the restaurant, you gotta sweat for some pho, which is fine with me.  Service was top notch, the guy was really nice and sweet, got us everything we asked for. The food was fantastic, I would absolutely come back to this place for lunch or dinner.
Food is ok to poor. Most notable is the terrible service and attitude of all the staff.  Tried several times because of location but will never come here again

The pho is average but I'm giving it 4 stars for the customer service. Typical food at a pho restaurant, nothing different from the other Vietnamese restaurants. I would say the employees are always there for you and very attentive in case you need anything.
I really enjoyed my experience here. People were very welcoming and the food was delicious. Definitely coming back because of the good food and the convenience of how close it is to my house.

We got excited about trying this new Pho spot so close to our house! The place is beautiful! But I've got today this is absolutely the worse Pho I've ever had! The soup was soooo oily! So oily that even my 5 year old daughter would not eat it.... Which also in my opinion wasn't very tasty either. Also... The noodles were already MUSH by the time we got them... Needless to say.. We are never going back again... We are Lemongrass Cafe lovers! We go once a week! Sorry Pho Mailan!

This place was completely amazing. Friendly, fast, clean and by far the BEST Pho soup we have ever had!!! We ordered the spicy beef noodle soup...I highly recommend it.  They really go out of their way to make everything perfect!!  This is def. Our new favorite place for dinner!!** Even the kids had no complaints!...We walked in at 8:20 unaware they closed at 9pm...even still...nothing was rushed!

Had pho. Not bad. Not too much ingredients to add to it. Portion was on point. Cost was decent. Banh mi sandwich was different from typical ones. Location was good. But nothing that stands out and yells for me to come back. That's why it's an average rating only.

I asked the hubby if we could get Asian takeout for dinner, and Yelp steered us to this gem.  Being Vietnamese, I tend to be picky about my Viet dishes!  I got the grilled chicken over vermicelli. My particular combo came with 2 pork egg rolls. Standard dish, with two chicken pieces perfectly marinaded and grilled. Delicious!  I also ordered the banh mi with the grilled chicken. So good! It reminded me of the banh mi my mom would make when I was growing up.  Since this was a take out order, I skipped on the pho.  The food was solid, the prices are low, and the service (take out) was friendly.   Definitely stop by this place if you get a craving for home good ole Viet food!
This place has Pretty good Pho. My Favorite were the grilled pork rolls though.  I wouldn't say it's the way though,sadly. But it's worth a try for sure.
I'm not a huge fan of Pho, but this place is good, I played it safe and got the S1 , spicy pho, and man thats Amazing!!!!

The food is very good for various selection of Vietnamese food! Pho is good as well as the rice and noodle dishes..,my favorites are chicken salad, lemongrass chicken with rice medium hot and combination bahmen sandwich. Staff is very friendly.

Honestly the best pho restaurant I have been to. Always super hot, not like other places I have been to. The egg rolls are delicious and the service is great. I drive all the way across town to eat here. It's the only pho restaurant I go to now. Definitely worth trying for anyone who likes Vietnamese food.

Always good, clean flavors, consistent on food and service (especially Vincent and Jon) quality!  We have been coming here at least 2x a week and ordered different items on their menu and know we can rely on Pho Mailan 100%.  The owner works hard, we see him serving, clearing tables, behind the counter, always friendly and this show us he cares.  There are many Vietnamese restaurants in Vegas but we're not surprised why Pho Mailan is always full even on week nights.

Service was great. We were seated immediately. The place was really clean and nice. It wasn't too crowded when we got there, since they were closing in an hour. I ordered a pho with beef balls and my boyfriend had their combo pho. I had a thai tea to drink and my boyfriend had a smoothie. Our food came out quickly. The pho was pretty good! Not too greasy. I thought the broth was a little salty, but my boyfriend thought it was fine. I ordered a small size and it was more than enough to fill me up. My boyfriend ordered a large and ate the entire thing and was really full after. The thai tea was delicious, but I finished it quickly. Overall, the food was pretty good for the price.

We found this ditty after doing a search on yelp. It was a bit hard to find as there are lots of plazas in the neighbourhood and they are a bit of a maze if you are not familiar with this area around Henderson.  If looking for the resto it's near Lee's discount liquors.   Entering the restaurant is was clean, nicely decorated and the people seemed welcoming. My friend who I ate with is Vietnamese so I told him usually I prefer a bun noodle dish vs a pho on a day when the weather is 75F outside. I went with a grilled pork and spring roll and my friend went with a catfish bun noodle. We shared a bit of each and his catfish was fried in a very interesting batter with a bit of dill. It was excellent crisp and very  unique but tasty flavour. My grilled pork was well seasoned with a nice lemongrass flavour, sweetness and a bit of salty. Overall it was a strong 4/5 for me. Clean, tasty, good portion size and price (not too heavy) is in my mind a slam dunk for Vietnamese food.
Got Pho combo. Tastes like how it's supposed to and they gave a lot of veggies. Happy tummy

Decided to try this place again after not going there for almost 3 years. It's still just "ok". I think it's a pretty fair 3.6-3.8 star Pretty much your typical pho joint. Prices are about right compared to other places. However - be warned, we were at table of 4 adults and 2 small children and they automatically tacked on 18% gratuity.  Not a big deal but just be forewarned as it might catch some people by surprise.  Pho broth was good, seasoning just right. I did notice that even though we ordered the pho with the well done beef, it still came out super red. Not a big deal because the broth is piping hot and if you mix it to the bottom of the bowl right away it will cook itself no problem.  The fresh spring roll presentation was kinda cool - it had the leaf part of the lettuce sticking out the side.

I went here with my family today since it's brand new and really close to my house. I ordered the spicy beef pho.. I forgot the name, but it was S1 on the first page. I didn't really like it. Even though it was spicy (and I like spicy), I thought it was kind of plain and very oily, most of the meat pieces in the soup were fat and there weren't enough noodles for me. I did try the regular beef noodle pho, which was okay, but different than what I usually expect. Then again, I'm a die-hard Pho Kim Long fan.   On the other hand, the service was great. The server was very nice and when my mom said that her drink tasted like diet, the server brought out another Pepsi for her to drink right away. I ordered the thai tea too, but like Melissa N. said in the other review... it was kind of different and not really the best thai tea out there.   Anyway, I'll probably go back with my boyfriend and order something different. My mom said the pork chops were really good, and she finished those. I just won't order the spicy soup again.

pho is alright, nothing to brag about. service could of been better. Only gave 1star because the lettuce for our spring rolls was not fresh. the lettuce wasnt as crisp and as if it was not rinsed well enough.

Came back and ordered banh Mi beef sandwich.  Pickled carrots and daikon was ok (not pickled enough), however the beef was so tasty I couldn't stop eating.  The baguette was toasty on the outside; soft and fluffy inside.  Add the jalapenos, cucumbers, and cilintros, you have an irresistible sandwich.

I always come here and service is always amazing. Last night I tried requested my food a little different than usual do to a strict diet and they were perfectly okay with it. Definitely recommend this place for food and service.

My husband and I stopped in here for lunch over the weekend and really enjoyed our meals. The inside of the restaurant was clean and simple.   The service was great from start to finish. We were greeted as soon as we walked in and quickly seated. The staff worked together to make sure we had everything we needed. It was a very short wait for our food.  Both of us went for Vermicilli Bowls. Mine had shrimp, sausage, pork, and egg rolls. His had sausage and egg rolls. They were both large portions full of meat, noodles, and vegetables. The flavors in the bowl were great. I liked the sauces on the table to help add more flavor and heat to the dishes. Pricing was very reasonable.

I just can't way enough positive things about Pho MaiLan! This restaurant is amazing, not only for its Pho but for its customer service. This is a hometown restaurant where the servers know you by face (and sometimes by name) and greet you as you walk in the door. We have ordered the soup and sandwiches, both of which are absolutely delicious. Portions are plentiful at Pho MaiLan. I will continue to frequent this restaurant whenever I'm craving a delicious, hot bowl of soup with all the toppings, and when I want 5 star service. By the way, Ryan is a wonderful server. Keep up the great work!

Great service and great food we will definitely be back!!! Fresh ingredients and friendly staff! We used to drive all the way spring mountain and decatur to have pho... But now we found one right around the corner from us!

Came here for the first time today for my pho experience. Service was ok. Not great. Not bad. Waitress seemed kind of overwhelmed. We watched two people walk out because they never got service. Food was the redeeming factor for this place. Food was very good. If they could fix the service issues this place would easily be a 4 or 5 star establishment.

Coming from Cali it's hard to find good food in Vegas especially when you're craving for a good bowl of pho. I went to Phi MaiLan with a low expectation hoping that maybe their food would prove me wrong and that it was worth going to eat and my instinct was pretty much right.  I ordered their pho and I tried the broth without putting any sauce just to see how it was and it wasn't bad. When I took a bite of the noodles, the noodles were really over cooked to the point where it was super soft. I had my girlfriend try it (she's Vietnamese) and she did not like it.  Before going to Pho MaiLan we read on the yelp reviews and it seemed to have many good reviews but like I said coming from Cali where there are lots of good food, this was not up there for us.  The staff was nice and friendly.

If you want the best Bun Bo Hue (BBH) in Vegas, Henderson, North Las Vegas and Summerlin, then Pho Mai Lan is the place to go.  We've been here several times since August, 2013 just to get the BBH.  It's authentic BBH and full of flavor.  However, we would not recommend anything else on the menu.  We tried rice dishes and appetizers and were not impress with any of them.  Waiters and waitresses were super friendly.

A solid choice. My large pho with steak and tripe ($9.50) was served fast and hot, and everything about it was just right. There's an extensive selection of other dishes on the menu as well, and I'll be back to try some of them next time I'm in the area...

Very disappointing. Checked their menu before visiting to make sure they had some vegetarian options. It appeared as if they had tofu rolls and a noodle option with tofu. I arrived only to discover they had no tofu and had to settle for the veggie egg rolls. I was going to leave but felt bad especially since I got lost looking for the restaurant.   The veggie egg rolls were uninspiring and had an odd sweet aftertaste to them. Something I am not used to. I understand restaurants will freeze egg rolls and cook to order but these rolls were not fresh at all. Due to the lack of tofu, they replaced the tofu In the noodle dish with more of the (to my dismay) veggie egg rolls. Everything on the menu had beef, pork, or chicken broth. Hmmmm maybe Vietnamese food is just not for vegetarians?  I am rating this restaurant two stars because the staff was pleasant and the space clean and bright BUT I will not be returning to this establishment.

I had lunch here yesterday. I normally don't give 5 start reviews, but because of the service of one man I did. Not to mention I enjoyed the food as well.  We accidentally went through the back entrance. I guess this happens time to time. There was a man who was sweeping and he graciously invited us in, joking how it didn't matter which entrance we came through. He turned out to me our server as well. It wasn't a large gesture, but I really liked his demeanor.  We ordered the tofu summer rolls. They were full of fresh veggies and breaded tofu served with peanut sauce with fresh peanuts.  For my main I had the beef ball pho. The broth had a nice rich meatiness to it. The balls had a good  consistency and taste. The noodles were round noodles, I'm use to flat noodles, but they were still good.  I'd recommend this place for your next pho craving!

Today was definitely a pho day for me. I wanted to try someplace new and this restaurant caught my eye.   I did a take out order of combination pho, shrimp rolls, the vermicelli with chicken and egg rolls.   What bothered me the most was they put the raw beef, for my pho, in a opened zip bloc sandwich bag, in the same container as my cooked meat and noodles. I thought that was kind of gross, I didn't think that was sanitary at all. That kind of ruined it for me. I was pretty hesitant to eat my food.   Other than that, everything was good.

I would have rated them higher if the staff was competent.  We came as a party of 5 including a baby and was brought to a dirty table. We did not receive menus after the tables were cleaned. After looking around we took 2 from another table. While waiting around for a high chair we flagged down an employee to ask for more menus and she said they were probably out. Haha wtf? There weren't any other tables waiting to order. She handed us a few menus that were not cleaned. We had 3 different people come to our table asking if we were ready to order but no one asked what drinks we wanted. I don't know if this was at shift change...it was 7pm. Two of us ordered pho and the rest of us ordered something different. All four of us received our meals at different times. We only received one soup spoon for two phos. The server who we had for the majority of the meal was polite enough, maybe she realised what a shit show we were in...but the icing on the cake was when I went to use the bathroom they were out of toilet paper, there was pee on the sink, the sink looked like it's never been properly cleaned and the floors were covered in a black slug along the wall. Gross. I hope the kitchen wasn't like that too. So their saving grace for the two stars? The food was actually good.

We went here for the first time for lunch yesterday. The Pho was excellent. The egg rolls perfect. The small portions are more then enough for one person. Nice place, plenty of room...i.e. your not cramped together like other  places. Very crowded when we were there but the service was good and the prices are very reasonable. Plus they offer red wines and sake..... We will be back.

We stopped in here for dinner one night while I was visiting my sister who lives in the area. This is her favorite place for pho in Henderson and it did not disappoint. The broth was very flavorful and they served our soup with plenty of accompaniments... this is probably the first time ever I did not have to ask for more basil and chilies. The service was excellent and I thought the décor in the place was really cute. Everyone was very friendly and made sure we were happy with our food. I also love the fact that they have a small kids pho so even her three year old walked out with a happy belly.  While we were there they were hanging up a new sign for their happy hour pricing. Only $5 for a bowl of soup or any appetizer. What a great deal!

There are so many different pho places here in Henderson and I have to say this is my absolute favorite.   I always love coming during the afternoon as it never is super busy around that time. There will be about only 3 other parties in there and it is pretty spacious compared to other pho places. The servers are friendly and quick to bring the food out. I love the waitress who leaves a pitcher of water at our table so we can refill our cups whenever.   My favorite starter to get is the spring rolls, they are nice and fresh but won't fill you up just in time for the pho. I always get P2 as I don't get too extravagant with my pho, the broth is the star in my opinion.   I always end up craving Pho MaiLan's pho more than any other place. Definitely a forever favorite.

It was gloomy day, looked like rain. So decided to get Pho, a Vietnamese soup.  I been driving by this Place everyday for almost a year. Finally decided to try it.  We got 2 beef soups with meatballs and thinly sliced beef, calamari, fried egg rolls and a banh mi vietnamese sandwich. The food was excellent. We enjoyed all, the broth was a little bland for my taste. I added some fish sauce, hoisin sauce, sriracha and pepper. My wife thought it was good, not a big deal for me.  If I could put a sixth star I would, the Vietnamese sandwich was excellent. I got bm1. With beef and pork, and it was tasty. I been tempted to get it for lunch because its so close.  We will back for sure, thank you Pho Mailan.

Don't believe their happy hour advertising, they tried to charge us regular price thinking we wouldn't notice in the bill and then the server said that the manager doesn't let them give shrimp for happy hour menu... When it clearly has an advertisement outside.

While normally amazing with great customer service with a smile. Today was sub-par with wilting poor quality vegetables for my pho. And today was service with an attitude. I'm not impressed! Management please address this!

I really love the food here, but every time I come the service is horrible! It takes forever to get your servers attention and most of the time they have to get a second person because they don't understand what you're asking. The ginger tea is great when they have it available, and most everything I've tried is good.

Good local vietnamese spot if you're in the neighborhood!!    The Bun Bo Hue Mailan and Pho Combo are both very good.  The Bun Bo Hue is filled with good cuts and also has a good amount of side veggies for you to add into your noodle soup.  The soup for the pho is on the lighter side which I like a lot.    The fried eggrolls and the the spring rolls are both decent, nothing special about them but they are good and what you expect.    The place is very clean and roomy, the service is usually really good.  Tien is really quick and friendly.

I was craving Vietnamese food and decided to come here....this place is nice and pretty upscale.  The food is pretty good.  The bun (noodles) with catfish is to die for.  The bun with grilled meats and shrimp was pretty salty.  The eggrolls ain't all that.  The spicy chicken tossed in fish sauce, oh so yummy...may sound gross but man, this is bar food.  Yeuummm!  If you are looking for the vietnamese cafe with the dripping filter, this is the place for you.  The service was very friendly and attentive.  I will be coming back here again!  Happy Eating!

I have been coming here occasionally for over 2 years, and I have never had a bad bowl of Pho. Portions are great, and the flavors are fresh. I wish I lived closer so I could be a regular customer, but I still get it every time that I'm on this side of town!

Came in this place last week.  1st Time trying this Pho stuff.  It was pretty damn good....Pho Sho.  Really didn't know what to get so I got the Pork Chops, now I dont usually get me some swine when I eat out but these chops were good.  We also got some soup,it was nice and spicy and the size was big (for the small bowl).  I give a 4 stars for the friendly and helpful service and for the portion size and quality of the food.  And since its jus down the hill from me, more than likely LilMark will be back.
It is my first time trying this food, and I can say it well satisfied me. Recommend it!!!

This is my favorite local Pho restaurant but the server tonight had way too much attitude to be a server. She was rude when she took our order and snatched the menus from our table and threw them down as she walked away. They really need to rethink who  they hire because I had to ask to have a different person to bring our food. Life is too short to deal with bad attitudes especially when I'm paying.    Update: I can happily say they got rid of miss moody and their service is back to normal. I eat here a couple times a month and it's my favorite place for good Pho.
Great food. Some were better than bay area. Portions are generous. off the strip, but worth the drive to get some good food.

I want to like this place more than I do because just as other reviewers claim the broth is the best. I've been in search all around our city for an all around consistent pho restaurant to frequent since I crave it literally once a week. One place will have a clean atmosphere but not have quality meats then another will have quality meats but not broth and so the search continues.

Been here a lot of time but my menu has changed since I don't eat meat anymore. With My lan they have variety of seafood on their menu. I'm glad this restaurant  is near my work so i can stop by after work. Oh and their customer service is superb, not to mention the owner is very friendly and courteous. Love this place.

Food was very good service was okay. The air conditioning was not working so we didn't stay long and people were sitting down then leaving but they were apologetic for it and they were having someone work on it not really too much else they could do

It's very authentic, good prices, I came  for the combination sandwich. However I eat lots of Vietnamese sandwiches and by far I really enjoy thier meats and veggies were very fresh. However I'm a hungry guy and the sandwich was so delicious I could another one but I felt as if the meats wasn't enough. I've had bigger sandwiches before just as tasty. I'm new to Las Vegas and was hoping to find a meaty viet  sandwich

I ordered the combination pho. The broth was not warm. When I say not warm, the meat was still rare and did not get cooked. I've tried pho at many places and this one in particular just wasn't anything special.   The marinated spicy wings were extremely oily and had a pungent weird smell to them. My boyfriend and I only had two of the six. We did not enjoy them.   I'm sure I could've ordered better but the spicy marinated wings were pictured on the wall and they were being portrayed as a popular choice.   I do like that this restaurant serves wine and beer.
Pho is excellent. It always tastes the same and does not disappoint. Ambiance is the usual mom and pop Vietnamese restaurant. Prices are reasonable.

This place is as good as it gets away from Spring Mountain Road in Las Vegas.  I would definitely return because 1) it is close to my house and I don't have to drive 20 miles to the city 2) it is clean and 3) the staff are friendly.    As far as pho goes, it is ok.

Coming from Orange County, we had a lot of excellent Pho choices in Westminster which was about 15 minutes away.  We had been searching for a pho spot here in Las Vegas with no luck.  I'm impressed with the pho broth here.  It actually made it on the pho scale where you can rate it.  Compared to OC Pho, it's an ok pho place.  Here in Las Vegas so far for us, it's 1 number.  We only wish it was closer to us, since we're off by Rhodes Ranch.    It's clean and good service here.  We came around 2 PM, there were about 5 other tables here.  We're looking forward to coming here when we make a trip out this way.
Pho' is one of my favorite dishes. I Love their food & service! My husband & I frequently dine there.

Really enjoyed my pho. Wife got a noodle salad that was cold, I don't know of she realized it was going to be cold. She ate it anyways and said it was good. Ambiance wasn't anything spectacular. Seating was fast and service was prompt

I have been in search for good Pho and so happy that I have found it.  Tastes great, good service, reasonable prices.  I have tried multiple Vietnamese restaurants around the area and this is the most consistent with everything - never disappointed.

We were a little concerned when we drove up at 730pm and there where no other customers. Our concerns went away when we received our food. We ordered summer rolls and pho. Both delicious. Also, while we were there customer after customer started streaming through the doors. By the time we left half the tables were filled with customers. Guess we just hit at the slow time :)

PHO OFH RETARDS. Writing this at Pho. Absolutely terrible service in fact one of the worst places I've ever been. It's full of retards, I didn't know if we sat on are own or escorted.  My lemonade was brought with a spoon in it no straw, not to sure if it's a Vietnamese thing or what. The food however is absolutely fantastic and delicious. Great food with terrible service is better than terrible food with great service.  I finally got a refill at the end of my meal and instead of replacing it with lemonade they gave me water.
Not bad in ambiance and price was not high. I enjoyed the spicy lemongrass and jalepeno chicken I chose. I would eat here again. Service was fine.

Pho MaiLan was really good tonight. I called ahead and was told my order would be ready in 10-15 minutes. I showed up 20 minutes later and my order hadn't been started yet. I was a little annoyed but then they explained to me that they didn't have any more chicken broth available and waited to ask me if the beef broth was okay. I appreciated the gesture and sat to wait for my pho. About 10 minutes later I have my to-go order of chicken and mixed vegetable with no noodles, just as I ordered. Flavor, size, and price were all exactly as I'd expect. Hopefully next time they have chicken broth available.

Was craving Pho, why is Henderson so void of such joints? Anyway, drove out from the southeast side in some pretty hideous traffic and we were both pretty crabby by the time we got there. They totally made up for it by being fabulous.  It's a strip mall restaurant, but not small. Clean, well lit, with nicely modern decor. Eclectic music (from Vietnamese romantic singing to Frank Sinatra to what sounded like French chipmunks - haven't decided if that's a plus or minus). The waitstaff was friendly and efficient. Prices on par. Plenty of selection in and out of Pho.  We ordered Vietnamese coffee and spring rolls. Both safe, both yummy. On to more complex.  I went ahead with the "famous" spicy soup - seasoned beef broth, rice noodles, flank steak, tripe, tendons, and that weird spam-like beef substance that these things come with. Got my plate of sprouts, cabbage, jalapenos, and limes nice and early. When the soup came out, my first sip of broth was pure heaven. It made Jim cry & chug water, which means it was spicy enough for me, but not overdone.  Jim got a chicken satay. Perfectly marinated. I got a bite, but that's all he'd offer, lol.  I did have to ask for cilantro and basil, but he brought it out right away, freshly washed and plentiful. Enough to make my soup orgasmic and have enough left over for omelets in the morning.  Totally worth the drive, will be back.
Ordered delivery via Postmates and was very impressed! Everything was beautiful and absolutely delicious! They are my new FAVORITE go to for Pho nights! A+

Basic beef pho hit the spot on a cool evening along with tofu salad roll - fresh and tasty - suitable for my wife's avoidance of meat.  The menu is ranging for most any palate and the entire restaurant is spotless.  Nice people run the place and the prices are consistent with others of its type.  Proximity to my home in Anthem makes it a new "go-to" spot.
Stopped in for lunch and ordered something new and was surprised by the flavor and meat in the stew !! Awesome tastes like a mother's cooking in the back !!!

This is PHO-tastic.  I really enjoyed this place.  1.  All the Pho here is very good. No need to discuss the PHO menu as it is going to be personal to you. If you want chicken, tofu, veggies, different meats. If you want well cooked meats or odd meats (Tendons, tripe) it is all available and up to you. All you need to do to order a great PHO is to just figure out the meat you want...  2.  Broth - tasty, clear, nice.  I tend to like a bit more of the green onion and bits floating around adding to the taste.  3.  Other Dishes - Had the spring rolls and they were very nice.  Had the barbeque ribs as well and they were tasty.  4.  Drinks- The green tea ice tea is very light and an odd color, yet it has a subtle taste.  If you like soda from fountain instead of can or bottle, this is the place.  5.  Ambiance - very nice, bright, plenty of room. I kinda did not like the serving trays that hold the condiments as these seemed a bit dusty and collecting bits of stuff in it.  DONT look in it. Otherwise, very clean and nice.  I say check this place out and enjoy it.
Food is delicious, atmosphere is nice and clean, and most importantly service is really good!!

New crew tonight. Staff seems out of sorts. Ordered a 33, nope none, okay I'll have a Tiger, nope, okay make it a Corona, sorry none are cold. Opted for the B18, grilled beef and onions. Dish came, no onions. Asked for some and though they did bring a plate, was told the B18 no longer includes grilled onion... Very odd.
Food was great but the service was awful enough that I feel awkward to ask what I need smh ..

Menu was simple and selection was good. The $6 small egg rolls were on the expensive side but they made up for the value in the large pho for only $9. Service was attentive and food was ok. No complaints here.

Delicious Pho! The broth was perfect - so yummy.  The round steak was tender and flavorful.  The portions are larger than normal - so a small bowl was perfect for me.   I also tried the calamari which was so yummy! I loved the batter - more of a beer batter than usual - i dig.   For beverages - our whole table got the club soda limeaide? It was so refreshing. Specially in combination with the hot steamy soup.   The service was also particularly nice - I'm not used to being greeted with so many smiles at a Pho restaurant. I felt very welcome.   I wish this wasn't so far away - I would definitely be a regular!

I ordered p3 which is pho with well done beef and flank. The broth was very flavorful and it came with a lot of green onions and cilantro which I like. I ordered the small and finished the whole bowl. If you have a bigger appetite definitely order the large size. It's a dollar difference but I'm not sure how much more they gave you. Overall I liked this place. It fulfilled my noodle craving and is especially good after a long night out. Next time I'll definitely try more things on the menu.   My friend ordered their bun bo hue. She liked it and said it was pretty spicy. Didn't get to try but it did look yummy.

Love this place! Their Pho is the best in town! I've had pho in other restaurants but they don't compare to Pho MaiLan. It's all in the broth...the layers of flavor are amazing! Clean, friendly establishment and consistently great food and service!
Great pho soup!!  Combo bahn mi sandwich was phenomenal! It had plenty of meat. They also don't skimp out on amount of shrimp in pho noodle soups.  Great service As well! Overall great experience!!
Best pho I've ever had. Egg rolls were amazing too. Home made lemonade and coffee. Staff is extremely friendly. Great place to bring kids for dinner

Pho weather season is in full effect and lately I've been craving pho like crazy. I came here after a hard days work but I didn't appreciate the service I received, especially after a stressful intense work day.   I came in and all the booths on the left were full. I proceeded to the bathroom to wash my hands and then tried to seat myself elsewhere. No wait staff to be found hence the fact I figured I would just seat myself. Plenty of tables were left dirty and the three booths in the other side dirty as well. I figured if I would just park it in the middle of the three Someone would clear the table for me. A man proceeds to ask me to move to another table because it was dirty I said no I'd like to sit here I'll wait so he said it would be a few minutes. He starts to clean the other tables far from me first and waits for me last. I know I could have sat somewhere else but it was cold and I was tired and I would have rather sat at a booth. When he finally gets to my table he cleans it quick and walks away. Moments later comes back drops a menu and walks away. No one has greeted me said hi, how are you? Nothing! He comes back and asks "are you ready" and I said "I'll have the pho tai please" he said ok and walked away.  Returned with water and walked away. No words being said. It's just a bit awkward. Walking away is a pretty common thing they do here at Pho Mailan. Shortly after placing my order a woman drops off my pho and walks away. Not even placing it in front of me. She places it in the middle of the table. I thought ok kind of weird but it was because she was grabbing the condiments for the pho which she dropped off again on the other side of the table and again walked away. Not even asking if I needed something else or if I'm doing ok. Nothing. I mean I didn't need anything else but it's the thought that counts. I actually did need a fork because my chopstick skills aren't the best. She smiled when I asked and brought it quickly. There was one gentlemen who asked if I was doing ok and that was much appreciated.   I'm giving two stars based on service but the pho alone could easily be a 4 star review. Very flavorful broth serves with a generous helping of both meat and noodles presented beautifully with onion, scallion and cilantro. I like to keep my broth pretty plain and add just a squirt of lemon and let the broth stand alone. In my option a good bowl of pho doesn't need much. I was enjoying my pho throughly until I found a shrimp tail at the bottom of my bowl. What if I was allergic?    Other than the sucky service this place has delicious pho and is sure to fix my pho craving when I'm need. I would still come back even though they're flat out rude. Maybe it was just an off day for them. We'll see next time.

I drove by Pho MaiLan all the time going home. This is located on Eastern and Sunridge Heights. And finally i just decided to give this place a try.  I give it a thumbs up!  This is a Vietnamese noodle house.  I ordered the pork with vermicelli and it came with the noodles.  The portions are pretty big it filled me up pretty quickly.  The pork and the noodles were awesome! The pork was marinated to perfection and it was not chewy or tough. It was just perfect along with the vermicelli. The noodles were nice and fresh along with the veggies that came with it. You can tell everything was just cooked and not sitting in the fridge for a long time.  I also ordered the fresh Vietnamese roll. That too was really good. Inside the fresh wrapped were veggies and vermicelli. You dip the rolls into this peanut butter base type sauce, which is mmmm mmmmm gooood!  Overall:  The service is great they filled your water up and did not have to be told.  They have free Wifi so if you wanted to get some work done you can.  This place is nice and quiet , really relaxing, different from those loud Pho places.  I highly recommend this place. This is a must try.   This goes on my top list of Vietnamese places to eat.

I'm stoked that there is a Vietnamese restaurant close to home! This restaurant is clean and is family owned. They are very attentive and friendly, which is a huge plus compared to similar restaurants.  I ordered the Bun Bo Hue, which is my second time trying this dish.  I was not disappointed at all. I like how they do not use the pork blood in this dish.  Chris ordered the beef pho with rare steak and he enjoyed it, but said he had better (3/5).  We also loveee spring rolls with peanut sauce, so of course we try it at every vietnamese place we go to.  We liked it and will probably always order that when we come back, plus it's $3.95 (i think).  I will definitely come back and try the bun thit nuong (sp?), another one of my vietnamese faves.  *oh I ordered thai tea*, but I guess I learned my mistake from ordering a thai drink from a vietnamese restaurant.  It tasted different and obviously not authentic. It still tasted decent, but I wouldn't recommend it.   I'll try coconut juice next time.
Great place to go for casual dining. Food is always great. They serve large portions for great prices.
Right across from my house and it's a great go to restaurant ! The pho has a lot of vegetables and the broth is really flavorful! Prices are very reasonable and service is friendly!

Banh Mi without cilantro?? Blasphemy!!  I was craving a good banh mi sandwich & after yelping for banh mi in Henderson, I found this Vietnamese restaurant that I had somehow previously overlooked. I had hubby pick up 3 sandwiches on his way home from work; the grilled marinated pork, the grilled marinated beef & the grilled chicken. The sandwiches themselves were pretty good although the meat is def not typical of what you get in a banh mi but more of what you would order on top of rice. The veggies were also a little over marinated for my taste.  The biggest oversight though in my opinion, was the complete lack of cilantro. Wha??? That's prob my favorite part of the all mighty banh mi.  The other issue was they said it would be 20-30 mins but when hubby got there right at 15 mins, they were sitting on the counter waiting for us which led to slightly soggy sandwiches.  I would prob order from them again but I will def be sure to ask for the cilantro next time & arrive earlier & take my chances with a short wait.

Love it! It's such a cute, delicious restaurant! It's decorated very modern and it's super clean! The waiters are very nice and they check up on you to see if you're enjoying your food & if you need anything else, but they're not all over your shoulder and checking up every second. The prices are very good & for five people, our total was only $30! Being a vegan, I only got their Tofu Summer Rolls - but they were so yummy! I also got the Young Coconut Drink, and it was sooo delicious, and they kept it in the actual coconut! And then after I was done drinking it, they cut it in half so I could eat the actual coconut.
