My family loved the Pho and said it was the best they ever had. The restaurant isn't crowded, and everything is clean and on point. For anyone in the area, I definitely recommend it! :)

Heard this place was new and wanted to see if it was any good. The atmosphere was a little bit different then most Pho restaurant and gave customers a more modern feel. I ordered the Pho with just beef and it tasted okay but it took forever for the food to come. All in all I would try them again and a different plate !! : )

The best pho in Henderson! The owner is so kind and welcoming and so are the rest of the employees. I have tried many different items from the menu and have not yet been disappointed. Service is quick and its even great to-go! It is definitely worth the try and prices are great.

Love this place, i have come here at least twice a month since they have open and yet to have an inconsistent experience. It is always on point. Came last week with 12 very hungover Club Crawlers, and we litterally ordered Half of their huge menu, we put this resto to the test, and they passed with flying colors!

Most worst service and food ever!!!! Super slow, if they don't have enough servers I would understand, but there are 3 servers and 1 cashier to service the whole restaurant with less than 20 tables. With less than 10 tables of customers they are already slow like this, I can't imagine what would happen if they are full house. Perhaps they need to hire more servers or just shut the damn thing down. Didn't get a chance to mention the food was NOT authentic at all!!! Would NOT ever come again!!!!

This pho place is the best pho restaurant I have ever been to. Their food is so delicious and their service is always on point! The dinning area is really spacious, clean, and the decor is like any other pho restaurant but very fancy looking LOL I always get their spring rolls and their shrimp pho, price is reasonable (roughly around $8 for a bowl) and portions is good enough to satisfy you. This pho restaurant is definitely a hidden gem!

The color combinations used with the interior decorations is far from your typical Vietnamese/ Asian design. I went with my mom and got the vermicelli noodles, with chicken, eggrolls & vermicelli noodles, with grill pork, eggrolls with the cold sauce that goes on top. The meat was well seasoned but a bit chewy. However, the lettuce, bean sprouts, and cucumbers they put inside were green and fresh. We also ordered chicken wings that were served with a sweet chili sauce. They put pepper in their flour batter that gave it a kick. They give you 20% off your whole menu as part of a promo they are running. Definitely take advantage of the promo! Other than the food that made me give them 3 stars, they had this asian sound clip that was about 20 seconds long that kept replaying, and it was loud too! By the end of the day, it was still stuck in my head! LOL

This place has got to be the cleanest Vietnamese restaurant, hands down! The staff are always so welcoming. I usually get pho with lean meat and extra bean sprouts and they give more than expected. I can't say I love the broth but the cleanliness, customer service, and thai tea compensate for it. Definitely a place to cure a hangover or a cold. =)

The pho was awful today. Noodles were not thoroughly cooked through leaving it dry and broth was not that hot either. They also skimped on meat, hardly any in there. I know it's lunch special but I used to get a decent portion. Also I came in 10 mins before 5pm which is when their lunch special ends. When I realized that they skimped back on their noodles and meat, obviously I needed another bowl to satisfy my craving. When I ordered another bowl, they charged me full price. They ran out of basil on me, boy just an all around whammy today. Should of just gone to Canes. Never again.   Still don't understand how they got a banner hanging outside saying best Pho, who voted? Questionable.

Wow... I can't even come close to expressing how happy I am to find this place. I just moved here from CT and there was only 1 place in all of the state that was worth eating pho at. I had to drive all the way to Boston or NY for good pho. I've tried lemongrass, there service was typical Vietnamese service(order, eat your food and get out) and their food was not even close to being good enough to deal with poor service to come back. Been to pho Annie's and pho Kim long.... some dishes were good, but if you're talking about pho or bun bo hue nothing is like Pho Mailan. I've given up all hopes of finding a good pho place, but then the Pho gods delivered an UNBELIEVABLY GREAT ONE instead. Let's just say I cried a little while eating my meal and followed it up by walking into parked car after leaving bc I was in heaven and didn't notice the fixed hunk of metal I was gonna walk into. Walking into a parked chevy did not damper my just then incredible pho experience one bit. Oh and talk about great customer service... THEY HAVE THAT DOWN PACKED!!! Going back right after this review. I went 2 days ago. Hehe :-)
Try the noodle dishes if it's too hot for Pho. They are well seasoned pieces of chicken and shrimp and quite tasty.

This WAS my go to place! Food was amazing service was great! But... That's all changed now I'll just keep it short.. Well try to! lol .. 1st. We went in and we ordered our usual (we've been coming to mailan for a little over a year) the server was some guy we never saw and he kept telling us we couldn't order a half order of egg rolls we kept telling him that we always get it so he finally said ok and walked away. When he came back he had a FULL ORDER of egg rolls!! Get it together new guy!! 2nd. It's one thing to have a sh*t ton of gnats flying around your restaurant but when I take a bite of my pho and a huge fly comes floating to the top of the bowl that's out of control!! 3rd. We will NEVER be back especially after reading that there was a dead roach on a damn table!! Fix your bug issues!!  GROSS! Seriously guys you are messing up! I hope you get it together for your future customers! GOOD LUCK. The only good thing they have going is the server Thi!! He should leave there himself to somewhere better!

We came here on a Saturday night and ordered  1. Crispy spring rolls, 6 2. Pho Tai Chin, 7 3. Bun Nem Nuong Thit Nuong, 8 For $26  - Nice seating. Spacious. - Can't speak to servers in Viet, but I liked Ryan's attempt to figure out what we ordered. He did have to come back and confirm our order after he went to the kitchen. He still forgot to take out the onions in the pho, but I guess it was our fault to test how authentic this place is. Haha. Great guy! Friendly.  - Fried egg rolls similar to the restaurants in China town. Better than Lemon Grass.  - The grilled pork and vermicelli was delicious. Yummy grilled taste. Fresh vegetables. Smaller than average sized portion.  - Average sized pho portion. Tender beef but lacked in quantity. Broth was good.  - Can't wait to come back during their HH.  - Quite possible the BEST in Henderson! Better pricing/quality compared to others in town.

I really like this Vietnamese restaurant. The food is always good, service is always friendly and the place is always clean...and doesn't smell funky. I used to come here a lot when my office was still in Anthem. I would always get a bowl of pho or grilled pork chop.  Pho: I normally get a bowl of pho with any of the following: brisket, flank, and steak. The broth is excellent. They have different combinations including one with salmon. 5/5  Summer Rolls: Shrimp, pork, vermicelli, and greens wrapped in rice paper. The 2 rolls are cut in half and served with a peanut dipping sauce. 5/5  Roasted Pork Spring Rolls: Roasted pork, vermicelli, and greens wrapped in rice paper.  Again, the 2 rolls are cut in half and served with a peanut dipping sauce. The pork slices have that grilled taste to them. 5/5  Bun Dac Biet: Fried egg rolls, grilled pork, pork sausage, grilled shrimp, cucumbers, bean sprouts, and peanuts on top of vermicelli. You get that vinegar + fish sauce on the side. My friend who absolutely hates egg rolls loved it. 5/5  The service here is always great. I joke around with the employees. In general, the place is clean but sometimes it takes them a while to clear out tables.

I LOVE THIS PLACE.  They have the best Bun Bo Hue in town!!!!  Everyone needs to try it. I come here to get Bun Bo Hue AT LEAST once in two weeks.  Their service is amazing. At times, the waitress/waiter forgets to pour water, but overall it's great.  If this place ever goes out of business (knock on wood), I am going to cry.  My favorite place to get Pho and Bun Bo Hue!
The are very timely on the pick up orders and the food is seperated so that my noodles don't get soggy. A place with great tasting food as well!

Best Vietnamese place in town. It's clean and tidy. They have almost everything you could think of. Good service as well. My personal favorites include their chicken and veggie phos and their grilled steaks. Great appetizers as well. Although, I don't recommend the fried calamari.

I have tried many different pho places and I must say this is my favorite one!  I usually order grilled pork plate, i think (the thin slices of meat). But anyways, it had a unique taste to it very different than the ones I usually had.  The food was very flavorful and it has a hint of spice to it.  I dont normally like spicy food, but this hint of spice was just enough to make me enjoy the flavors of it.  The servers are pretty good and friendly. The prices are decent and its worth spending on :]

Normally, Pho in an upscale area is a rare occurrence. Then add the fact that the place is bright, spotless, and got an A grade by the health department makes it almost unreal for a Vietnamese restaurant. By no means am I criticizing the businesses of my people, but most of the places I use to frequent in LA were C grade.  Pho MaiLan is a breathe of fresh air. The open feel and spread out dining area is a welcoming touch.   To start my friend and I got an order of spring rolls ($4.95). They were two fat rolls filled with lettuce, mint, noodles, boiled pork, and shrimp. It was nice to bite into them and not come out with a mouthful of noodles. The peanut sauce comes with pickled daikon and carrots. It tastes even better with a spoonful of the chili sauce.   Instead of getting Pho, I saw that they had a vermicelli rice noodle bowl filled with all my favorites. The Bun MaiLan Dac Biet ($8.50) was the perfect way to try a little of everything. The lemongrass pork was tender, flavorful, and plenty. If that was not enough, there was an eggroll, two pieces of grilled meat, a couple of shrimp, a mound of lettuce, mint leaves, and more pickled vegetables. It comes with a side bowl of Nuoc Mam. Spoon some over the whole dish, mix up, and it is a meal only a notch under my mom's level. Everyone is biased towards what we grow up with. My only complaint was that the meats were more on the salty side. My friend took a bite of it and said that he might forgo getting the Pho Dac Biet ( Regular $6.95) one day and order this instead. That in itself is an amazing feat, because he will spend a whole day hanging out at the house when my dad makes Pho and eat 4 bowls before the day end.  We also got a Banh Mi Thit Nuong to go for a friend. The meat came in a generous portion. It kept it's warm and tenderness for quite some time. The lean meat and filling were good, but the bread needs more of a crunch. It was too doughy for my taste. It is more expensive than most places costing around $5, but the meat alone is worth it.

I was not impressed in any way with this Pho. The broth, in my opinion, was not good. The broth kind of makes or breaks it and this one was unenjoyable. The service was equally unimpressive. Surprised to see so many glowing reviews. We could even not finish our soup.

I was pleasantly surprised by Pho MaiLan. Given some other Henderson/LV failures, I wasnt sure how good Vietnamese was going to be outside of the Spring Mountain area. Luckily the food here is spot on. Good quality, good portion sizes, decent ambiance. As others have said the service leaves something to be desired. Pretty obnoxious to be watching your server texting at a table when you need something, but I can overlook this for good pho.

Service is always wonderful here. They greet you right away and you can sit wherever you would like. The restaurant itself seems very clean and set up nicely. I give this place 4 stars instead of 5 because the food is tasty but if I'm comparing to other Vietnamese restaurants around town, I would have to say it's mediocre. The broth is a bit on the watery side and so is their siracha on the tables. They also pack way too much lettuce into their fresh spring rolls in order to make it appear more full. The prices are fair though and I'm actually a fan of their Asian chicken wings. I would still say to give it a try yourself.

Since I'm from Los Angeles, where there are tons of excellent Vietnamese and pho restaurants, perhaps what I consider average or good is skewed, here in Vegas? I haven't tried any other Vietnamese restaurants in Las Vegas yet, just Pho MaiLan.  The most off-putting thing about this restaurant was the service. The servers were OK (meaning, they seemed pleasant and indifferent*), but the service was almost non existent since they didn't seem to notice us when we entered or check on us when we were having our meal. (I wasn't wearing my invisibility cloak! Oy.) I had to flag down the servers to get any service, even to just get the menus.**   *Note 1: The workers were warm and friendly to one regular customer who entered to pickup his takeout order. But, they seemed apathetic to all the other customers.  **Note 2: The restaurant was at 20% occupancy when we arrived (around 5:30pm).   My dining companion and I both ordered pho dac biet. The food was average fare one would get at any given ordinary pho place...although, it tasted blander than average. (Side note: The customers were mostly non Vietnamese, myself included.)  The place looked clean and the standard pho restaurant condiments were provided at every table, which was nice: salt, pepper, sriracha sauce, hoisin sauce, and chili pepper sauce. I wanted a sauce dish, but didn't even want to bother wasting my energy flagging down the servers again for that, so I just used the plate beneath my pho bowl. (Although I had plenty of energy to write this review.)  Here is my ratings breakdown:  Ambiance and Cleanliness: 4 out of 5 stars (better than the average pho place)  Service: 0 out of 5 stars (Out of service! I have received far better service from fastfood drive-throughs.)  Food: 2.75 out of 5 stars (bland and ordinary)  VERDICT: It wasn't horrible, It was just EH. On a 1-10 scale, I give it a 4.5 (mediocre). On the star scale, I give it a 2.75 out of 5.

Very clean restaurant! Our waitress was very nice and quickly brought lime infused ice water (very refreshing)!  We ordered fried spring rolls, a beef baguette sandwich and an egg noodle soup...all was delicious and reasonably priced!  Will stop by this place again! :-)

Update: We usually go for lunch, but tonight decided to go for dinner. There are apparently a couple new servers. The one we got has no business being a server anywhere. Ever. Even the chef in the back expressed his discontent by ringing the bell several times when her dishes were not picked up. She was completely apathetic and incompetent, tossing the spoons down where they landed (together), not placing one at each setting. She looked utterly confused taking our order. I can't understand why she was hired!  This said, our favorite server Thai (not sure if I'm spelling his name right) came to the rescue, and fixed everything without us even having to ask!  The reason I updated this review is for those of you who got the new girl on your first visit. Please do not judge the restaurant by her. I can't imagine she will last. Go back and ask for Thai.    Fantastic experience every single time. The pho is our favorite in town, and everything else is fresh and delicious. The staff always goes above and beyond, the owner is very attentive and always has a smile. Do yourself a favor, and eat here. You won't be disappointed! We come 3-4 times a month.  Yeah.  We have a bit of an addiction!!

Solid Vietnamese. Family-friendly and excellent service. While they seem to have phenomenal pho with up to 7 kinds of meat, I actually didn't try any. In any case, their other food was bomb! On their rice vermicelli menu, Bun Dac Biet (B1) was a total meat fiesta with savory grilled marinated shrimp, pork sausage, and sliced pork and a fried egg roll that seemed like a bonus! Then their Banh Mi Bo Nuong (BM3) with grilled marinated beef brightened with carrot/daikon slaw and cilantro on a bun was so good I didn't want to share! Then my whole fam really enjoyed their Com Ga Nuong (C7)- fried rice full of little veggies topped with super juicy grilled marinated chicken.   From start to finish, service was amazing! In fact, we forgot our doggie bag and our server came out in scorching 110-degree weather to find us in the parking lot. Get your Vietnom-nom on!
Great food, good prices.  Will hit this place again when I come back to sin city!

Food was okay. They forgot about my order, so I ended up waiting a long time for my pho. I was starving. Won't be coming back and won't be referring others. Still got charged full price for the pho they forgot about until I reminded them about it.

I am visiting Vegas and wanted something fresh, so I came here.  The service was great and the place was clean.  I was happy to know they had some vegan options, but they were a bit bland. For example, the spring rolls could have used some carrots or other vegetable. The vermicelli dish could have used another vegetable, or a different sauce (it came with soy sauce). The specialties seem to be meat based, so, perhaps their meat food has more flavor?

Best pho restaurant in town I must say! I've been here a couple times and they have never did me wrong. Every visit was always perfect! Food is always amazing. The restaurant itself is clean and looks unique. Service is always quick and on point in my opinion. If you want a eat somewhere and you're in a hurry to go somewhere afterwards I would recommend coming here! Thank you Pho Mailan!
This place has the best pho, I even got my husband into it! Prices are so cheap, I'm not sure how this place stays open. Cute and clean decor, and the crispy spring rolls are tasty. Nom nom!

I always go to Pho Saigon8 for my Vietnamese cravings, but this time, I thought... why not give Pho MaiLan another shot since it's been a while since I've been there & technically, it's closer to my house.  I called to place a togo order.  I spoke to a gentleman and I ordered the Summer Rolls and the bun cha gio thit nuong (sliced pork & eggroll vermicelli).  I also asked for a side of "hot sauce" to go since I like my food spicy.  I was told that it'll take 15 minutes.    30 minutes later, I entered Pho MaiLan.  I was greeted by a server and I told him I have a pick-up order.  He walked me to the register and said, "Summer Roll, Bun, and a soup, right?!"    "No -- no soup for me," I said.    "No?  You didn't order soup?  Are you sure?"  "Yes, I am sure.  I asked for extra hot sauce though."  "Oh?  It sounded like you said you wanted a small pho when you called.  And I figured you meant you wanted small soup.  So, are you sure you don't want the soup?  It's only $1."  "Yes, I'm sure ... I just want the fresh rolls, my noodles, and hot sauce please."  "The soup is only $1.  Are you sure you don't want the soup?!"  SERIOUSLY?!!!      By this time, I was getting irritated.  "Listen, I do NOT want soup even if it's a dollar.  If I wanted soup, I would have ordered soup.  So, please,... can I just pay for my order?"    He took my payment and disappeared.  10 minutes later, there was still no sign of him.  I was baffled because first, I was told my food would be ready in 15 minutes but it's been well over 30 minutes since I walked in.  The restaurant was not even busy so what's taking him so long?!     As I'm hovering by the cash register, an article on the wall caught my eye... it reads...  DRAB SERVICE MARS A GOOD MEAL at Pho Mailan by AL MANCINI (http://lasvegascitylife.com/sections/eat-drink/dining-out/review-drab-service-mars-good-meal-pho-mailan.html).  This article was printed on May 8, 2013.  After reading the article, I shook my head.  Why the heck would the Management team frame this article and post this proudly in their restaurant?!  Is it to warn the customers that their service has NOT improved at all since 2013 and that we should just deal with it?!  Could it be the same server who help Al Mancini with HIS order?!  LOL!    Finally, another waitress passed by and I stopped her to inquire about my togo order.  A minute later, she came back with my order and said, "Here you go!  Sorry for the wait."  Whatever happened to the dude who took my order?!  Maybe he was pissed I didn't want the soup?!   Oh - yeah,... the food.  The Summer Rolls were good.  The bun... Meh!  The sliced pork were salty and fatty.  I think I should drive further to Saigon 8 next time.

This is my favorite place to get pho but don't go after 8:00 PM because they're all in a hurry to leave. For example, the utensils were just all dropped in the middle of the table. I could write a whole list but I won't do that lol. We've even witnessed them turn people away even before 8:30. Other than that, when I'm craving pho, I come here.

We enjoyed our lunch here quite a lot. Clean, bright and spacious dining area. Friendly and efficient staff. The pho was excellent and the sandwich bread was awesome, light and tasty. The summer rolls did have an unusually large amount of vegetable but I like it like that, it was like having a salad before my soul. Very happy and would recommend anytime.

It's a clean, cozy restaurant with friendly staff and reasonable prices. BUT they have ONE vegetarian option on their menu, fried tofu, and their pho is either beef or chicken based soup which isn't vegetarian friendly at all. Won't be returning!

Place was nice and clean and food was not bad.  Service was confusing because I did not know who really was our server.  Intentions were good, helping each other, but if I ask for something twice from two people you would think I will get it from one of them but I didn't.  Third time's the charm though! So good food, service ok.

The location and service are great. The food unfortunately was lacking in flavor. I hate adding salt to my food but there was really no choice. We ate Pho custom bolws with round eye, flank and tripe... I also ordered broccoli with it but it never came. We had the fried egg rolls too and had the same issue it lacked flavor. Sorry I wont be back I will stick with my spot Pho Saigon 8. I guess I will deal with bad service for great food.
This place use to be a 5 and I loved it. This is my 3rd times in a row that it's been bad. I returned the meal tonight; soggy noodles and the four slivers meat were 98% fat. So disgusting.
Great pho!!! Especially if you live in NYC with absolutely no authentic pho to eat!!!!!

ok. I've been a regular here for about a year now and have had nothing but great food and service. I'm not sure what's happening but they better fix it. QUICK.   service has been spotty for the last month and my last visit was the last straw. we came in and were led to a table by the window. a table that had a belly up roach on it. we were all kinda shocked and just stared at it. we called the server over and he was about to pick it up!! with his fingers!!! he must have thought about it and then used his rag. he started to walk away and almost like an after-though asked us if we wanted to sit at another table. uh YEA!   we ordered our usuals and waited. I started to look around and noticed the place was not as clean as it normally was. debris was building up along the edge of the window by the floor in the back. dirt was also accumulating under the booths, which was in plain eye view from my table.  our orders came and my extra noodles on the side were about half of what they used to serve. great... and my basil looked like it had seen better days. one of my meat pieces tasted not so good and my tendon was HARD and had an off taste.   overall this place itself looked like it had seen better days also. WHAT'S GOING ON PhoMailan???? we were huge fans, but it seems like since the manager (I think it was the manager) has been gone it has not been the same.  it takes a lot for me to put it out there like this and "one star" a business, but come on.  fix the problem.

I had a terrific banh mi sandwich, a vietnamese coffee and a fruit and coconut milk, fruit and ice dessert.  All these things were delicious.  My sweetie said his pho was ok but not great.  My friend didn't eat much of her meal, a dish consisting of beef, crispy noodles and veggies.  She said it was good hot but in a few minutes it had cooled and was tasteless and uninteresting.  The waiter said it was his first day and seemed very nervous.  This place seems fine if you order the right things off the menu.
I go here from time to time as it's close to my work. Food is exceptional, service is good and place is clean. I can recommend this place.

Come try their noodle bowls! We always get an a6 and a b11!! Their spring rolls (a6) are so yummy!!! The peanut dipping sauce...I could lick the bowl clean.   Their chicken pho is a little on the bland side but you cannot beat this place for good service and yummy food!!

I happened across this place while looking up Pho restaurants in Vegas. I haven't heard good things about the chains here (especially because several had been shut down for food-safety violations). So I decided to try this place for some Pho. And I'm SO glad I did. The management here is welcoming and the service was great!  Upon entering the smell is amazing. I just wanted some takeout but decided to stay the smell was so good. I decided upon a few things; chicken satay, the pork cabbage rolls, a chicken bahn mi sandwich, the seafood pho, and the husband had the beef brisket pho (all shared between 2 adults and 3 kids). EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING. I have picky eaters, and my kids tried, and liked, everything they ate here.  The sandwich was flavorful, the pork rolls were juicy (and the peanut sauce was the bomb - even though I have always hated it!). However, the pho stole the show. Flavorful broth, tender meat, and delicious veggies. And the price tag on the food we ordered? $35. I will be frequenting this place again. And again. And again.
When in Henderson/Green Valley stop by! Really chill atmosphere & modern decor, friendly staff, & great food! I haven't had a bad dish yet & that says a lot! Everything is delicious!

REALLY GOOD!! I wasn't sure what to expect from a place that there's not too much request for in nevada (in my opinion), but it was really delicious. Hubbz and I ordered to go and it was literally ready in about 5 minutes. I'm not sure if that's the same time frame if you sit down.  Either way its a MUST try.

My boyfriend and I love Vietnamese and wanted to try somewhere new. I looked at a lot of reviews and picked Mai lan because it sounded like people enjoyed it and the pictures were nice.   When we got there it wasn't very busy and were seating in a booth. I was looking forward to my vegetable pho, as I am vegan, and it was brought to my attention they don't over vegetable broth!! I use to love ramen but its only chicken or beef broth offered so I converted to a pho lover! I'm very disappointed to hear they don't offer this because traditional pho is vegetable broth or so I've been told. Instead of pho I was suggested to try another noodle dish offered except it didn't have broth and was cold. I think it was call bun, but I may be wrong.  It was cheap for what you got and the staff was kind. Ill be going somewhere else next time
This place is a very good pho place. My fiancé highly recommended it and when we went there it exceeded expectations! We each had pho and we left stuffed. If your in the area check it out!
Clean restaurant. Fresh taste. Diligent staff. And my God the broth was legit. My gf was upset they didn't have vegetarian broth (only beef broth), but I thought what they did have was outstanding.

After seeing so many of my friends posting pics of yummy looking pho to their facebook pages, I finally convinced my boyfriend to be adventurous and try it out with me since a new Pho restaurant opened up near us.  This used to be EVOS, a place I was sad to see go. But, they retained the clean, fresh ambience. It looked nice, maybe a bit too bright for my liking. I am sure I would have enjoyed my experience more in the dark as a matter of fact because my dish looked less than appealing.  About that dish, I told the nice waiter that we were very excited that this was our first experience with pho and asked if he could point us in the right direction for ordering. He picked something for us on the first page of the menu and said it's what everyone orders and we are sure to love it. I am going to attach an image of what he brought out. It was not what I expected at all, especially after seeing others images of pho that had more veggies and lighter looking noodles. I certainly didn't expect a hoof looking thing (others have commented that it looks more like a cervix) along with lots of grissle to arrive in my bowl of faux pho.   Because the service was so good, we decided not to say anything. And decided to pretend we were in Vietnam and that this must be traditional pho, whereas what other have been eating elsewhere must be the modernized version. I have since learned from someone who has eaten pho in Vietnam that what I ate didn't look like the pho she had in her travels. Oh well.  I really did love the service at this restaurant though. They were very attentive and nice. I'm thinking I just ordered the wrong thing? Will try out Lemongrass Cafe once I recover from this experience.  ***Update*** We should have expressed our disappointment to the staff while we were there but they were so nice that I didn't want to make them feel bad! Lesson learned. My apologies to the staff for not saying anything while we were there. I am sure they would have made good on the situation.

I will give this a 3.5 rating. I was craving Pho on a cold Saturday, and there isn't much up in my new Green Valley neighborhood so I make the venture up Eastern to Pho MaiLan. They have a Happy Hour from 3-6pm so I timed it right. I liked their menu, they have a lot of good selections. The restaurant itself has quite a few tables and is very nicely decorated, bright and cheery.   I ordered a Pho Tai Chin and thai iced tea, and both were delivered quickly. The Pho has a nice balance of meat and noodles, just a bit light on meat for me. The broth was also a little blah, so it required a few limes and some hoison sauce to perk it up. Served piping hot, I had to wait a bit until it was temperature ready to eat.   I would come back for sure. Its not as good as my favorite, Sidestreet Pho, but its fairly priced and decent. There's not much Pho in Henderson, so any potential business owners.....there's a goldmine out here waiting for you.

Came here due to high ratings. The place looks rather nice and the service was good.   I had ordered a Large Bowl of Pho and was so disappointed. I can nearly eat most Pho and say they all taste the same, but if I dislike it...that's pretty bad. In this case, Pho Mailan, you're a winner.   The meat was thick and hard to chew on. The veggie dish for our pho did not look fresh, but rather old.   Their broth was so bland, I had to add tons of hoisin sauce, but that still didn't cut it. My Brother-in-Law, however enjoyed his bowl. So out of 9 of us, 4 did not enjoy this visit. So u be the judge. He also ordered Thai Tea , but did not finished it.   I suggest ordering a small bowl to try them out before you waste your money on a large bowl. Just in case...

First off, this review is for the Pho only... My friend got another dish that he really enjoyed... and from what I have read, the other reviews rave about everything EXCEPT the Pho.   The Pho wasn't BAD, just wasn't.. good. I got the flank steak and it seemed to be lacking in the soup:[. The noodles were also different and not the regular vermicelli that I am used to. Sadly the noodles were also lacking in the substance department.. are they trying to go against the grain with their different noodles?? I don't know. But I prefer the standard.   I was left with a big bowl of beef broth that wasn't all too yummy and my Pho craving wasn't all too satisfied.   To return? Yes... just not for Pho.

Absolutely wonderful!  We came in from Spokane, WA and decided to try this place from seeing other Yelp reviews.  The food was fantastic!  Very fresh and lots of flavor!  I loved  B-18 on the menu.  It was so good, we came back 2 days later to have it again.  That says a lot when you are in such a large area with so many food options.  We will be back when we come back to Vegas.  This is a Must Try food location!

Been living in Henderson almost a year and had yet to try any Pho out here. Like a lot of reviewers, I'm from So Cal and worked in Orange County where there are TONS of noodle places. Needless to say, I was looking for a family-owned place with flavorful food. This is one of those places.  I ordered P4 (Pho Tai, Nam - Noodle soup with sliced round-eye steak, well-done flank) and my husband had P6 (Pho Chin, Nam - Noodle soup with well-done brisket and well-done flank) and we shared A17 (Smoked  Salmon Rolls - Smoked salmon wrapped in rice paper with mixed freshvegetable and pickles). Everything was flavorful and delicious. We got it to-go and it came packaged well with plenty of fixings for the soup. If you're someone who likes a lot of noodles in your Pho, get the Large size (same amount of broth but more noodles and fixings). The smoked salmon rolls were very fresh tasting and the peanut sauce was tasty.  Prices are very reasonable also ($8 for regular size Pho, $9 for large). We will be back!
Bun Bo Hue and Hu tieu Bo Kho are both really good. Tasteful with the right ingredients and spice. This s a regular place for my wife and I.

Where have you been all my life ...& Why haven't I been here before!   We've been living in Henderson for over a year now and I can't believe I've never been here.(sad)  Pho MaiLan is located In a small strip mall right on the corner of Eastern Avenue and Sunridge Heights Parkway right next to Lee's liquor and I drive past this place every single day.   We walked in at about 2:30pm (on a Wednesday) & we were greeted right at the door, shown to our table and handed a menu each, Our glasses of Water were then brought out and we ordered.  Love the prompt service!!  And with a smile!! (Very friendly)  I ordered the regular (P15) Pho Ga which is a healthy and super duper flavorful chicken broth with rice noodles accompanied by a side plate of Thai basil, bamboo shoots, lime and sliced peppers.   Add all that with a splash of Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce and my mouth was in heaven!   I always dig in and drink half the soup and then eat the chicken and noodles with veggies... kid habit I guess.  The regular is a decent portion and I couldn't even finish it - so I asked for a "to go" container to take it home.. I didn't want to waste my Pho Ga!  So portions are awesome! I did wonder what the Large looked like.... maybe next time!  Yummy food at a great price!  Regular is $8 Large is $9  What a cheap and healthy lunch!!!  I will be back for sure and would recommend you check this ONO place out!!   Ps. Tuesday's Senior day: 10% off  Pps. HAPPY HOUR DAILY 3-5pm - Dine in only -  Appetizers and soup for only $5!!!

Talk about some real vietnamese food being delivered right to your door step ( 3 mile radius, I am 7 miles away almost got turned down but talked him out of it, yessir!) Thanks to the pictures of food and the menus on yelp which helped out awhole lot. The phone order was easy and smooth. It took about an hour due to 2 deliveries before mine but well worth the wait.   We ordered the crispy fried spring rolls, Pho Tai Bo Vien, Combo vermincelli, vietnamese sausage and marinated slice pork vermincelli, and kalbi ribs with rice. The food was very fresh and really flavorful, everything was really tasty especially the broth of my pho, the kalbi ribs was the best, tender and packed with flavor.  My family and I loved every bite. We will be ordering more to come.

It's unassuming strip mall venue doesn't do it justice, Pho MaiLan serves up very good Vietmanese food in a market that offers very little options. The soup and rolls are great, but the meat is suspect as it usually is with this genre of cuisine. Stop by if you are into this type of food.

For me personally I love this place. Always consistent. The service is good and its so close to my house! Seems like a family own business which makes the vibe even cooler. Everyone that works here is always very nice and accommodating! I've come here so much that they even know my routine! Makes me feel like I'm apart of the fam! Haha!!

Pho MaiLan is one of my favorite pho restaurants in town and it just happens to be just down the street from my house. The food is reasonably priced and very tasty. The service is great to! While it is not as cheap as many of the pho places I am used to in SoCal, this place does not disappoint at all either.

I have been looking for a new Vietnamese Restaurant in Henderson.. I hate to drive to Spring Mountain..Looked up some review found Pho MaiLan & the review were really good..  Went there a couple of weeks ago it was really good We went back for Lunch today and was not surprised that they were busy..  The place is very clean and very open so you do not feel like some is sitting on your lap and listening to your conversation.. which is like what most Vietnamese Restaurants are like..  I had the same items again & the items were really good again..Egg Rolls really good.. I love the Beef Stew with Rice Noodle.. My son had Pho and said it was good..We had some items for take out ..the Grilled items on the menu really good also.. The service is really good.. friendly & fast.. price is just right..without the drive to Spring Mountain for Vietnamese food.. I have been eating Vietnamese food since the early 80's and this place is really good..

Love this place.  Service is always great and every dish my family has ordered has been delicious.  Grilled pork rolls is my favorite app.  Love the vermicelli bowls.  Especially the grilled pork and onion.  My kids love the pork katsu plate and the best soup is the Bun Bo Hue, spicy noodle soup.

We kind of stumbled upon this place but we were glad we did. This is like the authentic pho you find in Chinatown, except you're in Henderson.. plus, the service is waaaaay better. Definitely a place to go if you're looking for some yummy Vietnamese dishes and for a good price! They've got certain lunch deals and they're definitely worth it. So is the bowl of pho. It's good sized and tastes super good! We also got the chicken wings and those were boooomb. We were so happy to have eaten here and will for sure come back!

I've been to Pho MaiLan several times now. It's the closest pho joint to my house, which makes it the go-to by default. Mind you, I wouldn't keep going back if it sucked, and it definitely doesn't.  The pho is decent--good quality meat, broth isn't bad, and they give you a fair portion--and the service is excellent (as long as it's one of the adults doing the servicing... the couple kids who work there definitely don't have the same customer service ethic). Definitely the friendliest of all pho places I've ever been to (although Lemongrass is a close second in that department).  I've had several of the beef pho dishes as well as a couple of the vermicelli ones, one of the new banh mi specials (pork), and their new lemongrass grilled chicken plate. I'll break it down for you:  * The sandwich had more teriyaki-type sauce on it than most I've tried (not sure what that sauce a actually is, traditionally), but was really tasty. * I'm not the hugest fan of the pho ga (chicken soup) as I find it pretty bland compared to the beef pho bowls, but that's true at pretty much any pho place I go. Oh a whim, I tried the mi van special (like the pho ga but with egg noodles instead of rice), but the noodles were super gross and it didn't have any more flavor than the pho ga. I definitely wouldn't recommend that one. * Ok, the lemongrass chicken -- well, it was definitely chicken, but it didn't taste at all of lemongrass, and seemed like it was actually covered in some sort of watery yellow curry (like the yellow curry used in Hawaiian cuisine, but waterier and with less flavor). Seemed overly salty, too, and I didn't bother eating my leftovers later. Oh well.  Above varying food reviews aside, I'll still keep coming back for the friendly service & the decent beef pho. They're also always happy to give me extra scallions & onions, which makes my tastebuds happy!

So I made a to-go order today and well, the quality of the food was not the same as when I would dine in. I am truly disappointed. Rather than being honest and consistent, someone decided it's ok to trick the customer just to save some money. I drove from the east side just to come here! I was a regular and now, will no longer be coming back. Thanks for my burnt spicy chicken wings.

WILL NEVER come back here considering there are a couple of other better Vietnamese restaurants around the area.   I ordered to go and got: Beef wrapped in betel leaf appetizer Vermicelli with grilled pork  So I went to go pick it up and asked for an extra anchovy sauce that should come with the beef wraps. I've had this from other places and it usually comes with anchovy sauce AND on their menu it states "served with anchovy sauce". The employee (super nice btw) had no idea what I was talking about and said she would go and ask. Another employee came and asked me to elaborate. He then went back in the kitchen then came out and told me they were preparing it. I stood there a couple mins and the first employee came back and said let me check on it for you. Then I heard a voice from the back saying, "no there's no anchovy sauce. We don't have anchovy sauce. There's nothing. I don't know." So I figured okay they don't have it, whatever it's fine. But then the second employee walks out and hands me a container of some sauce. I ask if that's really anchovy sauce and he says yes. Really? You're going to lie to me? At that point I just grabbed my food and left.   Reason for 1 stars: 1. Don't lie to me. If you don't have it then just tell me that. Don't try to give me something else and try to pull a fast one on me. What if I was allergic to something in that sauce? Not cool 2. Vermicelli was decent. BEEF WRAPS WERE NOT EVEN COOKED ALL THE WAY THROUGH. They pretty much gave me raw meat. The only part that was cooked was the outside. Completely pink on the inside. That is definitely not how it should be served. I was so disgusted. That's a health hazard. If you can't make a dish right then TAKE IT OFF OF YOUR MENU!!! It's that simple.   I would give this place ZERO stars if I could. I'll pass on this place. Definitely not my go-to Vietnamese restaurant.

Perfect service, polite staff, clean restaurant, excellent Pho with perfect broth! We just stopped here on our way back from Arizona because we were craving Pho...everyone is satisfied with their dish!

Service and food was mediocre. Mom ordered bun bo hue, the busser, a Vietnamese lady told my mom they were out, not the waitress. Pho broth was bland. My che didn't even come out until the end of the meal and the waitress never once came to check up on us.

When I first walked in I liked how the restaurant was very clean spacious and modern. That's about all I liked :( My husband and I went here for dinner on a Friday night and they were definitely overwhelmed with the amount of people in there. I'd say the restaurant was a little over half full.   We ended up getting the wrong appetizer delivered to us, and the waiter spilled a bit of my husbands pho on his hands when he delivered it to our table. We both ordered pho and it was underwhelming. It wasn't very hot at all...just barely warm. It wasn't enough to cook the rare steak that was in my pho. The noodles were also overcooked and just mush.....blech. The broth was pretty weak and had a weird funky aftertaste to it too. Almost like a smokey flavor to it. I didn't care for it at all. No one came to check on us and we never got refills on our drinks.  We waited a while to get our check and finally my husband just got up and went to the counter to pay. While paying I saw someone else got pho spilled on them big time. I was confused since I saw so many 5 star reviews on yelp which was why I chose to try this place out. Maybe I caught them on a bad night? They definitely need to get their act together or hire more servers. Give this place a womp womp. Don't think I'll be heading back anytime soon.
I've been their regular client for prolly 5 years now. The service is always on point, food is bomb!!!

Finally decided to try this place so I could compare it to Pho Saigon 8 down the street.   Pho Mai Lan is a nicer / cleaner restaurant with better service. Their menu is extensive. They were really good about splitting the bill and didn't rush us (but were prompt when we asked for it).    I had the bun cha gio thit nuong (cold vermicelli with grilled sliced pork and crispy egg rolls), which was good, but the vermicelli was a smidge overcooked for my taste.   I also had the nem nuong cuon (roasted pork rolls / spring rolls), which were alright. The rice paper was fresh and not dry/thick, but the filling was mostly lettuce and not that interesting. The roasted pork was also not the same as the kind I'm used to finding in spring rolls, but it was tasty nonetheless.   Unfortunately, since I've never had the bun at Pho Saigon 8 and I have yet to try the pho at Pho Mai Lan, my goal of trying to compare them was not met. whoops! I'll definitely be coming back to give the pho a try.

Great food so far I have my new pho soup spot.  Pretty clean.  Service can be awesome.  Thai iced tea is pretty good.  Been here several times now.  They even have a happy hour.  Egg rolls have fish in them however still very good unfortunately my wife is unable to eat them because of the fish.

This is a good place to find Vietnamese food if you live around the area and don't want to drive down to Chinatown.  I always order the grilled short ribs since I can't make them that well.  That's my go to dish and they've always been delicious and perfectly charred.  I've also had the banh mi there.  It's okay, nothing outstanding.  The service as well is just okay.  This place all in all is just okay.  Like I said, it's a good alternative when you're in the area and don't want to make the drive to more options in Chinatown.
Affordable, fast &  yummy.. Customer service was excellent!  FYI they have happy hour from 3-5pm

Walked in and was surprised this place didnt reek of pho like other vietnamese restaurants do. Its really clean, has modern decor, and excellllllent service! Even a good place to do large groups. We ordered:  - meatball pho - nice and clear broth. we're so used to the LA pho thats laden with fat on top and MSG. LOL. I actually didn't taste the meatballs but the bf said he really liked it a lot  - pho with crispy flank and marbled brisket (#7 i think?) - i looove the texture the flank! it was chewy and crunchy and so good. you will like it if you like cartilage-y stuff. the marbled brisket was delicious too. they also give you a good amount of meat in there  - spicy noodle (their special) - this comes with the bigger rice noodles. the broth may look scary and spicy but it actually wasnt spicy at all (for me). it had pieces of lemongrass, galanga and other spices in there. very very tasty! and also, lots of meat in it  - pork chop on rice - came with two big pieces of pork cooked perfectly  Overall, very good!! I love the selection, especially all the different types of meat you can get in your pho. Plus they have banh mi, rice dishes, and other things I wanna try. We will return!
